Juan es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus cinco hijos en el sector Mocce, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la panadería, el fabrica sus productos en un horno  instalado en un ambiente de su casa. Este negocio constituye la única fuente de ingreso familiar con la que ha sustentado a su familia durante todos estos años. Los panes que produce los distribuye el mismo a algunas tiendas y hogares de la zona. Su labor es diaria y demanda de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y responsabilidad.

Debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña, Juan se encuentra elaborando panetones, la calidad con la que elabora sus productos ha hecho que la demanda por ellos crezca pero el ya no cuenta con el capital suficiente para seguir comprando más ingredientes e insumos por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de harina especial, pasas, frutillas, huevos y envases de plastico con los cuales pueda seguir elaborando este producto típico de la temporada.

Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa por lo que se esfuerza a diario para reunir el dinero suficiente. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan is a 50 years old family man, who lives with her wife and their five children in the Mocce district, in the city of Lambayeque, twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years he has owned a bakery business and he has a baking space in his house. This business has been the only source of revenue for his family for all these years. He delivers bread to stores and families of his neighborhood. He works very hard, every day, with dedication and responsibility. For the Christmas season, Juan is baking panettone (traditional Christmas cake) and the good quality of his products has pushed up the demand. As he does not have enough operating funds to buy more baking materials and ingredients, he has requested a loan of 1500 PEN, that he will use to buy special flour, raisins, candied fruit, eggs and plastic bowls, so that he can keep baking this season typical product. He is eager for finishing to build his house and for this reason he works daily very hard so that he can make enough money. He obtained previous loans, that he fully and rensponsibly repaid.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking materials and ingredients to prepare panettone.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
El banco comunal Prosperidad está formado por un grupo de amigas que por la necesidad de salir adelante y demostrar a su familia que en la vida todo es posible solo hay que ponerle ganas y deseo de superación, formaron el grupo para acceder a los créditos y así hacer crecer sus negocios, todas  viven en la urbe Cuencana, tierra de muchas tradiciones y  ensueños, ciudad a la que todo quien la visita hace la promesa de volver a visitarla.
 
La señora Ana León es socia de éste banco,  tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil casada es  madre de cuatro  hijos todos  mayores de edad  siendo sus tres primeros hijos casados y viven  independientes, su última hija es madre soltera y es con quien vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del  hogar, ella cuida a su nieto hasta que llegue su hija del trabajo, su esposo ya no trabaja por una lesión en su columna obligándole a cerrar su oficina de Arquitectura, Ana junto a su esposo lograron  construir su casa propia. 

Ana tiene su propio taller de costura en donde fabrica principalmente ropa de dormir  y otras  líneas que están de moda o de acuerdo a la temporada, sus confeccionas las entrega al por mayor  en los mercados de La Feria libre de Cuenca,  Azogues, Cañar, Santa Isabel,  y en su comunidad a los vecinos,   no tiene horario fijo de trabajo ya que cuando tiene mucho trabajo  labora hasta altas horas de la noche de domingo a domingo para cumplir con los pedidos, los días miércoles entrega los pedidos  a sus clientes y únicamente descansa cuando no tiene obras pendientes, ésta actividad aprendió  un poco de su suegra y el resto por  habilidad y necesidad.

 Lleva un año  trabajando con su banco comunal  incentivada por  una  socia de éste banco  que es su proveedora de tela, con los créditos accedidos ha comprado materiales para sus confecciones e incrementando  su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo realizado  va comprar tela, hilos, encajes, elásticos, agujas y muchos accesorios  que le hacen falta  para confeccionar sus prendas y  una parte para pagar un deuda que tiene.

Su sueño es terminar todas sus deudas  y que Dios la bendiga en su trabajo como hasta ahora lo ha hecho para poder ayudar a sus hijos en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Prosperidad is made up of a group of friends. Out of the need to get ahead and show their families that everything in life is possible if you have the drive and the wish to overcome, they formed a group to access loans and thus grow their businesses. All of them live in the city of Cuenca, land of many traditions and dreams, a city that all who visit promise to visit again.

Ms. Ana L. is a member of this bank. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children. All of them are adults. Her first three children are all married and live on their own. Her youngest daughter is a single mother and she lives with her at home, sharing the household expenses. She takes care of her grandson until her daughter comes home from work. Her husband no longer works due to a spinal injury that forced him to close his architectural office. Ana and her husband were able to build their own home.

Ana has her own sewing workshop where she makes mainly pajamas and other lines that are in style or according to the season. She delivers her produtions wholesale to the Feria Libre markets in Cuenca, Azogues, Cañar, Santa Isabel, and to her neighbors in her community. She has no set work schedule since when she has a lot of work she works until the late night hours from Sunday to Sunday to finish the orders. On Wednesdays, she delivers the orders to her clients and she only rests when she has no pending orders. She learned this activity a little from her mother-in-law and the rest from ability and need.

She has worked with her communal bank for a year, encouraged by a bank member who is her fabric provider. With the loans she has accessed she has purchased fabric for her sewing and increased her business. When the new loan comes through she will purchase fabric, threads, lace, elastic, needles, and many accesories that she needs to make her clothing and a portion will be to pay a debt she has.

Her dream is to pay off her debts and that God will bless her work as He has done so far, to be able to help her children as much as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, lace, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica la venta de granos, tanto de los que produce ella misma en sus tierras y los que compra de otras personas. Mary siempre está al pendiente de las épocas de mayor comercio, para ello viaja a la zona urbana aledaña a su comunidad para vender sus producto en las ferias comerciales. Mary vende al por mayor y menor, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda con el transporte de la mercadería. 
Para el futuro, le gustaría establecerse en un local comercial, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Esta es la oportunidad número 11 en que tiene un crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mery is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three daughters.

She has been selling grain for five years, some of which she produces on her own land with the remainder acquired from other growers. Mery is always looking for the best times to make large sales. She travels to commercial fairs in the urban areas surrounding her community in order to sell her products. Her husband helps her with the business by transporting her merchandise. Mery sells both in bulk and in small amounts. In the future, she would like to establish a commercial location where she can sell more comfortably.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Mery promises to remain responsible with her payments. The money she requested will be used to purchase additional inventory in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of grain

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita J., 44 years old, is a rice grower. She tills a small hectare of farm in their village, hoping to attain an abundant harvest for her family. The harvest is saved for the family's consumption. If they have plenty of harvest, they sell the remainder to rice traders for additional income for the family.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crop well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GLADIS tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Sus hijos de la socia son Jean Carlos y Lucero, ellos estudian en el colegio. La socia trabaja en el seguro social de salud del Cusco como lavandera y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de limpieza. Ya son siete años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como detergentes, escobillas, jabones y muchas cosas más. 

La socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis is 30 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has two children, Jean Carlos and Lucero, who are high school students. Gladis works for a health agency in Cusco as a laundress and also operates a small business selling cleaning products. She has been in business for seven years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Gladis is a working mother and entrepreneur who strives for her family to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more products such as detergents, brushes, soaps, and other items.

Gladis is a native of Cusco and a member of the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Cusco was the ancient capital of the Incan Empire and one of the major cities governed by the Peruvian viceroy. It is also declared a World Heritage site and known as the archaeological capital of the Americas.

Gladis is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergents, brushes, soaps, and other items

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento NUEVA AMISTAD, es un Banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo este Banco esta conformado por 11 integrantes 8 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las socias se dedican a la venta de carne, verduras, comida y tienda de bario y otros, Sra. LUZ es la presidenta del Banco y tiene un hijo y su actividad es otorgar viveres a facilidad a requerimiento de las personas y tiene su madalidad de pagos semanales, quincenales y mensuales tambien trabaja en un Hospital y de esta manera tener otra fuente de ingreso . La Sra. BEATRIZ VIRGINIA, es la secretaria del banco y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica al comercio venta de verduras, fletes de VHS y punto viva es decir tiene una tienda de barios en su mismo domicilio y con el prestamo ha logrado incremetar  su capital de trabajo y siempre esta pensando en invertir en nuevos  negocios , la Sra. Betariz es una persona muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. La Sra. MICAELA KARINA,  es la tesorera en el banco y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estan en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes, talcos y otros, para mejorar sus ingresos e incrementar su capital de trabajo ella es muy responsable y se observa muchas deseo de superarse.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA AMISTAD” Community Bank is already on their second loan cycle. This Bank has 11 members, 8 Women and 3 Men. The group members sell meat, vegetables, food and have a neighborhood store and other jobs. Mrs. LUZ is the Bank president. She has one son and she sells supplies as per personal order. Her method of payment is weekly, biweekly and monthly. She also works in a Hospital so this way she has another source of income. Mrs. BEATRIZ VIRGINIA is the bank secretary. She has 2 children and she works selling vegetables, VHS rental and phone booth, meaning she has a neighborhood store in her own home. She was able to increase her working capital with the loan and she is always thinking about investing in new businesses. Mrs. Beatriz is a very responsible person and she would like to do better. Mrs. MICAELA KARINA is the bank treasurer and she sells beauty products. With the loan she was able to buy her products that were on sale in bulk such as perfumes, deodorants, powders and others, to improve her income and increase her working capital. She is very responsible and she shows a great desire to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASE WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Las Provincianas Group

texts.es:
“LAS PROVINCIANAS ” es un grupo de 9 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”, ellas concientes de mejorar y fortalecer sus negocios, necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo y seguir operando en sus negocios,  sobre todo en esta época de fin de año donde la demanda de productos se incrementa.
Ellas  tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de chamarras, chompas, verduras, mantas, calculadoras y otros, esta es la segunda oportunidad que solicitan el préstamo a través del financiamiento de kiva.
texts.en:
“LAS PROVINCIANAS” is a group of 9 women and 1 man. They attend their meetings in the Main Center “Alto Lima”. They are conscious of improving and strengthening their businesses. They need the loan to increase their working capital and to continue running their businesses, above all at this time of year when the demand for their products increases. They have their own sales businesses such as jackets, sweaters, vegetables, blankets, calculators and others. This is the second time they are applying for a loan through kiva financing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: America Del Rocio

texts.es:
America M. de 33 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento que esta ubicada en La Perimetral en Guayaquil, America comenzó desde muy joven cuando vio que su mama  necesitaba un ingreso mejor en su hogar y comenzó a investigar que hacia falta en su sector para poder tener éxito en su negocio, puso una pequeña tienda de confitería.

Ahora America trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 en la que vende los jugos a $ 0.75 c/u, colas a $ 0.55 c/u, dulces según su precio, una de las complicaciones es no tener una de mejor construcción en su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 4 hijos uno de 13 años, 10 años, 4 años y 2 años ellos le ayudan en la tienda.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 2 docenas de jugos, 2 docenas de colas y confites, en el futuro quiere agrandar su local y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
America M. is 33 years old. She lives in a cement house located on the outskirts of Guayaquil. America started working very early when she saw that her mother needed a better household income. She began researching sectors that were missing in the community and in which she could have a successful business. Eventually she decided to open a small confectionery shop.

America currently opens her shop from 7am until 9pm. She sells juices for $0.75/each and colas for $0.55/each. Sweets vary in price. One complication is that her business is not located in a well-built structure that will allow her to satisfy the needs of her customers. She has 4 children (ages 13, 10, 4, and 2) who help around the shop.

With this loan she wants to buy two dozen cases of juices, two dozen cases of colas, and an assortment of sweets. In the future, she wants to enlarge her shop and see her children continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase juices, colas, and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cereal stocking.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento FATIMA ya trabajo un ciclo en nuestra Institución, es un Banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo esta conformado por 13 integrandes 12 Mujeres Y 1 Varon, las socias se dedican al comercio y venta D. verduras, cosmeticos, viveres, ropa  y otros. 

La Sra.TRINIDAD, es la presidenta del banco y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. edredones por mayor es una persona bastante dinamica y responsable, con el prestamo incremento su capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. JULIA MARGARITA, es la secretaria en el Banco y tiene 2 hijos, y trabaja como chofer es propietaria D. taxi y con el prestamo ha logrado realizar mantenimiento a su movilidad  para poder trabajar sin ningun inconveniente.

La  Sra. MICAELA, Es la tesorera del Banco y es una persona joven y se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estaban en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes, talcos y otros, lo que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The “FATIMA” Community Bank had already worked a loan cycle at our Institution. This Bank is already in it’s second cycle. It has 13 members, 12 Women and 1 Man. The group members sell vegetables, cosmetics, supplies, clothes and others. Mrs. TRINIDAD is the bank president and has 2 children. She sells bedspreads at wholesale. She is a quite dynamic and responsible person. She increased her working capital with the loan. Mrs. JULIA MARGARITA is the Bank secretary and has 2 children. She is a taxi driver and owner of the taxi. With the loan she was able to have maintenance work done in order to work without inconveniences. Mrs. MICAELA is the Bank treasurer. She is young and she sells beauty products. With the loan she was able to buy her products in bulk that were on sale such as perfumes, deodorants, powders, and others. This will allow her to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE GOODS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of mobile telephones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Buena Vecindad Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento BUENA VECINDAD  viene trabajando en nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, tiene como principal caracteristica que la mayoria D. las socias son antiguas, se dedican a la venta D. CDs, carpetas, buzos, polleras, confección D. chamarras y mantas. 

La Sra. ROSAMARY, es una D. las socias fundadoras, ocupa el cargo D. presidenta y tiene como negocio una tienda, con el prestamo a incrementado su capital D. trabajo y comprara más productos D. primera necesidad, con los ingresos D. su negocio tiene pensado ahorrar para la educación D. sus 2 hijos mayores que se encuentran en la universidad. 

La Srita MARIBEL,  es una joven participante ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, es auxiliar D. enfermeria y tambien trabaja realizando encuadernaciones en su domicilio, con el prestamo a logrado comprarse una perforadora para carpetas, lo que a permitido agilizar su trabajo y aumentar sus pedidos, mejorando D. esta forma sus ingresos. 

El Sr. ALEX,  es el tesorero del banco, se dedica a la venta D. CDs en la cuidad D. El Alto, con el prestamo a podido viajar hasta la localidad D. Desaguadero fontera con el Peru y compar por mayor VCDs, CDs para Mp3 y Mp4, logrando D. esta forma diversificar sus productos, con estos ingresos tiene pensado ahorrar para comprarse un kiosko por el centro D. la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Buena Vecinidad" has been working with our Institution since the year 2007. Its principal feature is that the majority of its members are older, and they sell CDs, binders, sweatshirts, and skirts and they also make jackets and blankets. Rosamary is one of the founding members; she holds the title of president and her business is a store. She will use the loan to increase her working capital and will buy more products that are basic necessities. With the earnings from her store she plans to save for the education of her 2 adult children who are studying at the university. Maribel is a young member who holds the title of secretary. She is a nurse's aiD., and also has a bookbinding business that she carries out in her home. With the loan she will buy a drill for binders that will help to speed up her work and increase her orders, in this way increasing her income from this source. Alex is the treasurer of the bank. He sells CDs in the city of El Alto. With the loan he will be able to travel to the locality of Desaguadero, on the frontier shared with Peru, to buy VCDs, CDs for MP3 and Mp4 at wholesale. In this way he can manage to diversify his products, and with this income he is saving to buy a kiosk in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital:

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is fifty-six years old. He is married and his wife has given birth to five children who are currently in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, etc. He is also a bicycle repairer. He wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk etc. to expand his business. He believes that with increased income, he would be more capable of financing his children’s education to provide them with life opportunities better than what he had.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LUCILA tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Sus hijos de la socia estudian en el colegio Gorki tiene 16 años y esta en el quinto grado de secundaria y Karen tiene 14 años y esta en el cuarto grado de secundaria. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de artesanía en el aeropuerto de “Velasco Astete”. La socia tiene un pequeño puesto de trabajo llamado “Don Jorge” donde vende cerámicas de arcilla y chompas de alpaca. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que de muy niña trabajaba lado de su mamá vendiendo artesanías. Ya son como seis a siete años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías como chompas que lo traen de la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno.

La socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucila is 41 years old, married, and has two children attending secondary school. Gorki is 16 years old and in Level 5 of secondary school. Karen is 14 years old and in Level 4 of secondary school.

Lucila divides her time between her household activities and her business selling handicrafts at the Velasco Astete Airport. She has a small vending post called “Don Jorge” where she sells ceramics and alpaca wool sweaters. Lucila has been working since she was a young girl helping her mother sell handicrafts. She has been in business for approximately 6-7 years and has done very well as a result of her hard work. Lucila is a working mother and entrepreneur who strives for her family to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more handicrafts, such as woven sweaters, to have shipped in from the city of Juliaca in the Department of Puno.

Lucila is a native of Cusco and a member of the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Cusco was the ancient capital of the Incan Empire and one of the major cities governed by the Peruvian viceroy. It is also declared a World Heritage site and known as the archaeological capital of the Americas.

Lucila is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Rebecca is a fashion designer. She designs and sews dresses for sale and also for clients who place orders. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has hired hands she works with. Rebecca has been in business for seven years and desires to give her business a facelift. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics and other accessories in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Effua

texts.en:
Effua is a 48-year-old married mother of four children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. 

Effua works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers. Effua buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro M. G. tiene 58 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Ellos tienen 20 y 17 respectivamente y los dos viven en la casa con su esposa.  El crédito lo quiere para comprar de terneras para que sirvan de cría. El puede obtener mejor ganancias con la venta de las crías. Hace muchos años que el ha dedicado a  la ganadería y quiere crecer. Es la trecer  vez don Ramiro se financia con FUDECOSUR, en el pasado obteniendo montos de 100000 y 200000 colones. Estos prestamos le han ayudado a permiten salir adelante por la forma de trabajo en que operan. El es el presidente del comite de credito de Platanares.  El espera que tenga un buen bienestar economico que le permita ayudar a la familia y el estudio de los hijos. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramiro M. G. is 58 years old, married, and has two children who are his highest priority. They are 20 and 17 years old respectively, and both live at home with him and his wife. This loan will be used to buy calves for breeding. He hopes to obtain better earnings upon selling the offspring. Ramiro has been raising livestock for several years and wants his business to grow. This is the third time he has received financing from FUDECOSUR. His previous loans were in the amounts of 100,000 and 200,000 colones, and have allowed him to stay ahead and keep his business in operation.

Ramiro currently serves as president of the Platanares Communal Bank. He hopes his family will be in a good financial situation to enable his children to continue their studies.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for breeding

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with four kids. Currently, one of the kids is in school, but the others have completed senior high school. She lives together with some of her children in a family house in their community. She trades in smoked fish. She sells from a shed in the local market square. She procures her fish from big time fish mongers and retailers. She also trades in yams and beans. She has been in business for ten years. According to Comfort, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family's finances.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in central Ghana.

Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes from a chop bar by the roadside. She buys the ingredients for her dishes from nearby communities.

Mary has been in business for over twenty years. She is requesting this loan so she can buy ingredients in bulk and so increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk for the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: K. Jeanne est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Minonkpo à Cotonou. Mariée à VIHO Simplice, un soudeur, Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne a un autre enfant à charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a pas été à l’école ; elle vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot accompagné de sauce et de friture, etc.) devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne fait ses achats. Jeanne rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans l’optique de développer plus son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Jeanne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capitol of Bénin, in 1968. For the past ten years Jeanne has lived in Minonkpo at Cotonou. Married to Simplice Viho, a welder, Jeanne is the mother of four children who are all sent to school. Jeanne has one other child in her care. Jeanne lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the family expenses. Jeanne did not go to school; she sells food (rice, beans with sauce and fried food, etc.) in front of her house. Jeanne does her shopping at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Jeanne repays her loans. In order to further grow her business and better satisfy her customers, Jeanne is requesting another loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food supplies (bags of rice and beans), sauce condiments and peanut oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 38 years old, and is a wife and mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells pastries, meat pies and donuts. Grace is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase food ingredients in bulk and, in time, to serve her customers. She believes your support would enable her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband and to provide for the children. Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells doughnuts. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beans

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: A. Fatima est née le 03 Janvier 1966. Mariée à YAYA Zimey, un militaire, Fatima est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a seulement un an que la famille s’est installée à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Fatima n’a fait que l’école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Fatima vend de la nourriture (haricot, riz accompagné de sauce, etc.) devant le Ministère des Finances à Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Fatima s’approvisionne. Fatima exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans. Fatima rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle, Fatima sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Fatima A. was born January 3rd 1966. Married to Zimey Yaya, a military service man, Fatima is the mother of two children who she sends to school. It has been a year since the family has settled in Agla in Cotonou, the economic capitol of Bénin. The couple shares the family family expenses. Fatima only went to primary school. To provide for her needs, Fatima sells food (beans, rice with sauce, etc.) in front of the Minister of Finances at Cotonou. Fatima gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Fatima has been doing this for about ten years. Fatima repays her loans. To strengthen her funds and increase her stock of products, to better answer her customers requests, Fatima is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of bags of rice and beans and ingredients for sauces (tomatos, onions, hot peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a 53-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Adwoa works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a baker who bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Adwoa buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando D. is a corn grower. He manages a small parcel of land to be able to provide his family an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. Aside from having corn, he also raises four cows, three pigs and chickens.

He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his crop well.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Praise Be To God Group

texts.en: Felicia is 38 years old, and is a wife and mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells pastries, meat pies and donuts. Felicia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She is the leader of village trust bank group called “Praise be to God”. All the members are engaged in trading. They work so hard to put food on the table of their households and also support their kids in school. They believe the loan will help them to be more resourced to purchase food ingredients and stocks in bulk and, in time, to serve their customers. They believe your support would enable them grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and stock

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Juliana works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader who trades in all kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc., on a table top at the market square. She says she buys her goods from nearby communities. Juliana has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es: La señora Juana Yadira L. O. tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el Barrio de los Laureles Norte, es madre soltera, sus hijos tiene las edades de 18 y 20 años de edad, sus hijos son independientes y sobreviven realizando labores temporales, su mayor logro en la vida sería el poder realizar unas mejoras en el hogar y poderles ofrecer una mejor vivienda para sus hijo pero este logro lo consumara a medida que pueda conseguir mayores ingresos, es por esta razón que ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar ropa nueva y poder fertarla para el periodo navideño pues es de una alta demanda y planea aprovechar la temporada, esto beneficiaria la economía del hogar y brindaría mejores condiciones sociales para la familia L..
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Yadira L. O. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. She is a single mother of two children, ages 18 and 20, who are independent and support themselves by doing temporary work. The greatest achievement she would like to obtain in life is to make a few home improvements in order to provide better living conditions for her children. She needs to continue generating better earnings to achieve this goal, so she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing to sell for the Christmas season. Since demand is higher during this time of the year, she plans to take advantage of the season. This will benefit her household finances so that she can provide better conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Túcume, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de cinco años se dedica a la confección de ropa, tiene instalado en su casa un pequeño taller donde confecciona las prendas que le solicitan sus clientes. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia.

Debido a la temporada navideña María desea ampliar su negocio con la confección de nuevas prendas para ofrecerlas en venta, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en materiales, como telas e hilos.

Su más grande anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y producir más ropa para instalar una tienda de prendas de vestir. María ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in the city of Túcume, which is in the province of Lambayeque, located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been producing clothes for more than five years. She has a small workshop in her house where she manufactures garments that her customers have ordered. This business provides her with the necessary income to cover her personal expenses and support her family.

Due to the Christmas season, María wants to expand her business by manufacturing new garments to offer for sale. However, she does not have sufficient capital to reach this goal, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase materials such as fabrics and thread.

Her greatest dream is to expand her business and produce more clothing to keep her shop in operation. María has previously worked with our Institution and has proven she is a timely and responsible client when handling her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba P., muy conocida en el barrio la Paz, ubicado al Sur Occidente de Barranquilla, por su especial sentido de solidaridad con quienes la rodean: Inició su negocio con $30.000 que le prestó su hermano, con lo cual compró interiores para niños, enaguas y tendidos de cama. Sus primeros clientes fueron los profesores del barrio y sus vecinos, ella compraba esta mercancía en colmenas ubicadas en el mercado de Barranquilla para  luego venderlas por encargo.

Rosalba, inició su vinculación a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo en el Programa de Grupos solidarios hace 18 años, su primer crédito con esta entidad fue de $30.000 que invirtió en la compra de mercancía variada y salió a ofrecerla a personas recomendadas por sus clientes  con el fin de vender en mayor cantidad, aumentar su clientela, obtener mas ingresos y poder pagar el préstamo. Desde ese momento ha recibido 26 créditos, reembolsados oportunamente lo que ha abierto las puertas por su excelente historial crediticio. El tener un negocio le ha representado a nivel personal autonomía, confianza, reconocimiento de su familia y de la comunidad y le ha servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda, pues al principio solo contaba con una habitación;  hoy  ha levantado 3 dormitorios, mejorado pisos, paredes, cubierta, cocina y el baño, por eso siente especial preferencia por la Fundación que la ha acompañado en este propósito.
Rosalba es la típica mujer costeña alegre, tranquila y buena gente, como la describen quienes la conocen, ella aprendió a elaborar ungüentos naturales para los dolores musculares y los vecinos la buscan cuando necesitan de su ayuda.

Su negocio actual es la venta de mercancías por catálogos, basada en los pedidos de sus clientes; pero últimamente compro una vitrina para poder almacenar y exhibir desde su vivienda, los productos que no ha incluido en la solicitud que hace a su proveedor y a los cuales no puede responder oportunamente, es por ello que espera surtirla con el presente crédito por valor de $1.300.000 invirtiendo en la compra de sandalias, juguetes, conjuntos de niñas y cosméticos. De esta manera empieza a cumplir el sueño de tener un almacén de variedades.
texts.en:
Rosalba P. is well-known in the La Paz neighborhood (which is located in the southwest of Barranquilla) for her sense of solidarity with those around her. She began her business with 30,000 COP that her brother lent to her. With his loan she bought children’s underwear, women’s slips, and bed sheets. Her first customers were the teachers in the neighborhood and her neighbors. She bought these items in the market stalls located in market of Barranquilla and then sold them to people who requested them. Rosabla began her association with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the Solidarity Groups program 18 years ago. Her first loan with this organizations was for 30,000 COP, which she used to purchase a variety of merchandise and sold it to people recommended to her by her clients, with the idea of selling in greater volume, gaining more clients, and earning more income so she could repay the loan. Since that time she has received 26 loans, which she has repaid on time, and which have opened doors for her because of her excellent credit history. Having a business has meant for her, at a personal level, having autonomy, confidence, and the recognition of her family and the community. It has also allowed her to improve her housing conditions—when she first started her house was only one room. Now she has three bedrooms, a good floor, walls, and a covered kitchen and bathroom. Because of this she feels a special preference for the Foundation, which has accompanied her in this process. Rosalba is a typically cheerful woman from the coast. She is a calm and oood person, which is how people who know her describe her. She learned to make natural balms for muscle pains and the neighbors look to her when they need help. Her current business is the sale of merchandise by catalogs, based on the orders from her clients. However, she recently bought a vitrine case to store and exhibit items in her house. These are items that she hasn’t included in her request to her supplier and also some products which are left over for her when they don’t arrive on time for the customers. She wants to use this current loan of 1,300,000 COP to purchase a stock of sandals, toys, outfits for little girls, and cosmetics top ut in her vitrine. In this way she can begin to achieve her dream of having a variety store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stock of sandals, toys, outfits for little girls, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose M. V. tiene 34 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su padres, son tres miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros para engorde.  El trabaja con su familia mas que todo en ganadería. Es la primer vez don Jose se financia con FUDECOSUR. Este prestamo le ayudaría a aumentar ganancias en un futuro. El ha dedicado hace 5 años cuidar ganado. El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. Le meta de el es que el prestamo le ayude a aumentar los ingresos economicos y así buscar cada día el bienestar de su familía. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jose M. V. is 34 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his parents, thereby making three members of his family. The loan he requested will be used to purchase calves for fattening. Jose works with his family in every aspect of raising cattle. This is his first time to receive financing from FUDECOSUR. The loan will help increase his earnings in the future. He has been raising cattle for the past five years. Jose has not had any other loans with formal banks. His goal is to use this loan to help him increase his income and provide for his family’s welfare each day.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: A. Kaï vit depuis 15 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KUASSI Martin un pêcheur, Kaï est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Kaï vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Kaï n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Kaï vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot) et aussi du poisson fumé à son domicile. Kaï s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Kaï mène cette activité depuis environs 7 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’élever le niveau de son activité, Kaï sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kaï A. has lived 15 years in Flégnon in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Martin KUASSI, a fisherman, and has two children, both attending school. Kaï lives with her husband and children, and the couple share support for the family needs. Kaï has not attended school. To meet her children's needs, Kaï sells food (rice, beans, and smoked fish) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and has been performing this activity for the past seven years. She is a former customer of ALIDé, having already received two loans from the association, both of which were fully repaid. She now requests a third loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and also her level of activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish and food supplies (rice and beans)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma D. is a farmer. She has a 1-hectare farm and she grows cassava in order to earn enough income. Aside from farming, she also retail processed food. Though she is already 56, she is very strong and still capable to manage a business.

She is hoping to receive a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her cassava.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a 60-year-old married mother of six children, some of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Araba works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a baker who bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Araba buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is 36 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Salamatu works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader and trades in all kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (fruit from the African garden egg plant), etc. on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Salamatu has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Adjoua Florence

texts.fr: L. Adjoua Florence est née en 1960 et vit au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 12 ans environs. Mariée à OZON Pascal un pêcheur, Adjoua Florence est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Adjoua Florence a un autre enfant à charge. Adjoua Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Adjoua Florence n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Adjoua Florence vend des poissons fumés au Port de Pêche à Cotonou. C’est au bord de la mer que Adjoua Florence s’approvisionne. Adjoua Florence a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. C’est pour agrandir davantage son activité, pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle que Adjoua Florence sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adjoua Florence L. was born in 1960 and has lived in the Fiégnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past 12 years. She is the mother of three children who are enrolled in school and has another child at home. She lives with her husband Pascal OZON, who is a fisherman, and her children. As a couple, they work together to meet the household expenses. Adjoua Florence did not go to school.


For about 10 years, Adjoua Florence has been selling smoked fish at the Fishing Port in Cotonou. Adjoua Florence gets her supply of fish from the ocean. Adjoua Florence has previously obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Adjoua Florence is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to improve her business and better satisfy the needs of her clients.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Indoamérica, de la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años de dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral en su casa. Usualmente cría patos, pollos y ovejas los cuales comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Este negocio constituye su única fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante.

Ella considera la crianza de sus animales como una tarea que demanda mucha responsabilidad por lo que trata de brindarles una adecuada alimentación en base a maíz, polvillo y pastos naturales. Debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña, Mariana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para engordarlos y ofrecerlos en venta, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en excelentes profesionales en el futuro. Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condicion de madre soltera.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 30 year old single mother. She has three dependent children and lives in the home of her parents, located in the Indoamérica section of the city of Lambayeque which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, Mariana has been raising and selling small animals and poultry from her house. She usually raises ducks, chickens, and sheep and sells them at the Moshoqueque Market (the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo). This business is her only source of income, so she is always striving to stay ahead.

Mariana considers raising animals to be a job that demands much responsibility. She provides adequate nutrition through a combination of corn, fodder, and natural grasses. Due to the upcoming holiday season, Mariana wants to purchase more animals to fatten and offer for sale. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to see her children become excellent professionals in the future. She is responsible, hardworking, and has managed to get ahead despite being a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to sell

loans.name: Assurance Group

texts.en:
Francis is forty-three years old. He is married and the father of four children who are currently pursuing education in senior, junior and primary schools. He lives with his family in their own house in a farming community. Francis is a petty trader and trades in foodstuff like cassava and plantain. He purchases these foodstuffs from farmers in the villages in bulk and supplies to food vendors in his town. Out of this business, he takes care of all his children in school.

He is the leader of a village trust bank group called Assurance. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travel. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids' school fees. Your support would enable them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase gari, beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is thirty-six years of age and married.  She mothers four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

Veronica is a trader. She trades in bags of cement. She sells in a store by the road side in the community. Veronica procures her goods from Accra. According to her, she has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: C. H. Anna est née en 1990 et réside au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. C’est une célibataire qui n’a pas encore d’enfant. Anna vit seule et assure seule ses besoins. Anna n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Anna vend également des produits de coiffure (mèches, tissages, etc.), par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Anna s’approvisionne. Anna a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Anna sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour agrandir son activité et constituer progressivement une épargne. Cette épargne lui servira plus tard à ouvrir son atelier de coiffure.
texts.en:
Anna C. H. was born in 1990 and has lived in the Fiégnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past ten years. She does not have any children, and must support herself because she lives alone. Anna did not go to school, but she did learn how to be a hairdresser. Anna also sells hairdressing products (highlights, hair extensions, etc.) via the distribution system. Anna gets her supplies at Lomé in Togo, a country that borders Benin, and also at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Anna has previously obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Anna is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to expand her business and increase her savings. She plans on using her savings open her own hair salon in the future.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hairdressing products (highlights, hair extensions, etc.)

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a thirty year old widowed mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Sophia works hard to be able to meet the needs of the family. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers. Sophia buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Mainor

texts.es:
Mainor R. F. tiene 28 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su familia de 6 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener mas posibilidad de vender mas crías. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de granos basicos complementado con la ganadería.  Es la primera vez don Mainor se financia con FUDECOSUR.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que pueda salir adelante y que la familia se pueda tener un ingreso. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mainor R. F. is 28 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his family of six members. This loan will be used to purchase cows to raise for milk production. Mainor wants to slightly increase the number of animals he owns so that he has more opportunities to sell the offspring. This the first time Don Mainor has received financing from FUDECOSUR. He has no other loans with formal banks. He hopes to get ahead so that his family can have an income.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Morrison

texts.en: Morrison is thirty-four years old, and is single with no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a coastal town community popular with tourists in the central region of Ghana. As a result, the main occupation of the locals is farming. Morrison deals in car fuel: diesel, petrol, engine oil, and other motor accessories, which he sells from a roadside tank. He buys fuel from the tankers that supply the filling stations. Morrison has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy fuel in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy fuel

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: 50-year-old Sarah is a widow and mother of four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a coastal community that is popular with tourists in the central region of Ghana. The main occupation of the people is fishing. Sarah is a trader. She trades in hardware such as bags of cement, roofing sheets, etc. She sells in a store by the road side in the community. Sarah procures her goods from Accra, the country's capital. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy hardware stock

loans.name: Rock Of Ages Group

texts.en: Simon is forty-six years-old. He is married, and the father of five children who are currently pursuing education in senior, junior and primary schools. He lives with his family in their own house in a farming community. Simon runs a grocery store and is also a taxi driver. These are his main source of income with which to support his family. He is the leader of a village trust bank group called Rock of Ages. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Sènemè Bernadette

texts.fr: H. Sènemè Bernadette vit depuis 20 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à COKOU Folly, un pêcheur, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais il ne reste qu’un enfant à sa charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Bernadette n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 20 ans, Bernadette vend des poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Bernadette s’approvisionne au Port de Pêche à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Bernadette manque de moyens financiers pour satisfaire la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Bernadette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sènemè Bernadette H. has lived for 20 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a fisherman names Folly Cokou, Bernadette is the mother of four children who all attend school although only one child still resides in her care. Bernadette lives with her husband and one child. Bernadette did not attend school. For almost 20 years, Bernadette has been selling smoked fish at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Bernadette gets her supplies from the fishing port in Cotonou. She is an old client of ALIDé and successfully repaid her two previous loans. Bernadette does not have the financial means to meet the demand of her large clientele and it is for this reason that Bernadette is requesting her third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fish

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 45 years-old, married, and blessed with four kids.  Currently, one of the kids is still in school, while the others have all completed senior high school. She lives with some of her children in a family house in their community. She sells frozen fish, meat and spices from a shed in the local market square. She procures her fishes from big fish cold stores and retail. She also trades yams and beans. She has been in business for ten years. According to Abena, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and other assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help to improve her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty years-old and married with five children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Theresa works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in all kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. on a table top at the market square. She says she buys her goods from nearby communities. Theresa has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and resale of hair extensions

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: M. Emilienne est née en 1961 et vit au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 48 ans environs. Mariée à FOLLY Victor, un pêcheur, Emilienne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Emilienne ne vit actuellement qu’avec deux des enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Emilienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs trente ans que Emilienne vend des poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Emilienne s’approvisionne au bord de la mer à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l’institution. Ces deux crédits ont été bien remboursés. Emilienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Emilienne M. was born in 1961 and lived approximately 48 years in the Flégnon area of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Victor FOLLY, a fisherman, and has four children, all of whom attended school. Emilienne is currently living with two of her children and her husband, with whom she provides support for the family. Emilienne has not attended school. For the past thirty years Emilienne has been selling smoked fish in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She gets her supplies from the seaside in Cotonou. She is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted two loans by the organisation. Both loans were repaid in full. Emilienne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, to increase her level of activity and better respond to her customer's needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fish

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a forty–five year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Comfort works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in maize and plantains, which she buys in bags from nearby towns. Comfort has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure more bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a 32-year-old single woman without children. She is a petty trader, meaning she sells cloths, linen fabrics and kids clothes. Afia is constrained by access to funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase better quality and larger quantities to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics, linen and cloths in bulk. Her greatest desire is to expand her shop and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesa tiene 57 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Tiene 19 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con sacos vacios propios y con un poco capital que tenía por lo que así fue que su negocio incremento en cierto momento. Su actividad económica es la venta de sacos vacios y envases plásticos. Por lo que son muy útiles ya que la mayoría de las personas los ocupa para guardar maíz, frijoles, arroz, entre otros productos y le gusta mucho su trabajo.  El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima  ya que últimamente tiene mucha demanda. El sueño de él ha sido terminar de construir su vivienda para él y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 57 years old. He takes care of his 3 children. He has been in the business for 19 years. He started his business with his own empty bags and a little capital he had and it started to grow. His business is the sale of empty bags and plastic containers. These are very useful since most people use them to store corn, rice, beans and other products. He really enjoys his work. The goal of this loan is to provide working capital for the purchase of inventory since demand has increased lately. His dream is to finish a house for him and his children.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a forty-eight year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers. Sarah buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is twenty-seven years, married and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cosmetics, assorted pomades for hair styling, powder, creams and make-ups to her loyal clients in the neighborhood. She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to adequately support her family, especially her kids' education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Z. Julienne est née en 1968 et vit depuis 41 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SINDETHE Saturnin, Julienne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Fiégnon. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Julienne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Julienne vend des savons liquides et aussi du poisson au Port de Pêche et à son domicile. Julienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Julienne a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Julienne Z. was born in 1968 and has lived for 41 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Saturnin Sindethe, Julienne is the mother of four children, all who attend school. Julienne lives with all her children and her husband in Fiégnon. The couple shares the cost of the family expenses. Julienne did not attend school. To meet the needs of her family, Julienne sells liquid soaps and fish at the fishing port and from her home. Julienne gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Julienne has run this business for approximately ten years and this is her third loan from ALIDé. Julienne successfully repaid her two previous loans and has requested this third loan in order to increase her stock of products and to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of liquid soap

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is sixty-years-old. She is married and has six children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Aba is a trader. She trades in printed fabrics. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for four years and wishes to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is 60 years of age. She is widowed and has six children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly farming.

Esi is a trader who trades in vegetable cooking oil – palm oil. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Esi also deals in firewood. She procures her goods from nearby towns. According to Esi, she has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis A. S. A. tiene 18 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en China Kicha con su familia. El crédito lo quiere para reparar el moto de trabajo. El trabaja como un agricultor en fincas alejadas de su casa y en algunas epocas del año, trabaja en construccion. Este prestamo le ayudaría para transportarse al trabajo .  Es la primera vez don Luis  se financia con FUDECOSUR. El desea que pueda llegar mas rapido al trabajo y su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis A. S. A. is 18 years old and single. He has no children. He lives in China Kicha with his family. The loan which he seeks is for the repair of his motorbike, which he uses to get to work. He works as a farm worker on farms far away from his house and, in some seasons, as a construction worker. This loan would help him transport himself to his job. This is the first time that Don Luis has sought financing from FUDECOSUR. He wants to be able to arrive at work faster. His goal is to help his parents.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
Santigie B. is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a petty trader at the lorry park near her husband's store. Santigie deals in hardware tools and bicycle parts and has been in this business since he left school 15 years ago.  

He believes that his turnover is small because of the small amount of working capital employed in the business; however, the potential for increased sales for the type of goods in which he deals is very high. Sometimes he has to direct some of his customers to other dealers in the town especially when the gadget required is not in his store.

Because of the aforementioned, he wants to take out a loan from ARD so that he can increase his working capital. Santigie is believed to be honest and hardworking by his suppliers and friends. He wants to rent a bigger store at the lorry park when he gets the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 49 years old, married with six children, all of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Stephen is a hard working man. He is a trader who trades in maize. Stephen buys bags of maize from nearby towns and supplies these to food vendors in his community. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan in order to procure bags of maize so he can increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: K. Léontine est née en 1980 et vit depuis 25 ans au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HAGBOFOU Thierry, Léontine est mère de trois enfants. Deux des enfants sont à sa charge. Léontine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Léontine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et nourrir ses enfants, Léontine vend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante. Léontine vend également de la nourriture. C’est depuis cinq ans que Léontine exerce cette activité. Léontine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.
