C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits à ALIDé. Les deux crédits ont été bien remboursés. Léontine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Léontine K. was born in 1980 and has lived for 25 years in Fiégon a Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Thierry Hagbofou, Léontine is the mother of 3 children. She still looks after two of them. Léontine lives with her children and her husband. Together, the couple supports the family. Léontine did not go to school. In order to meet her family's needs and feed her children, Léontine sells smoked fish from a moving cart. She also sells other foods. Léontine has done this for five years. She stocks up on supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Léontine is an old client of ALIDé, having previously received two loans from them. These credits she repaid in full. Léontine is asking for a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her stock and better meet her customers' demand.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fish

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en:
Faustina is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of six children who are currently being educated in senior, junior and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house in a farming community. Faustina runs a grocery store and also sells cereals. She makes income mainly from these businesses to support her family. 

She is the leader of a village trust bank group called Glory. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travel. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their children's school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Betty works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

She is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian staple food made from maize). She sells by the roadside and buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Betty has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is forty-nine years of age, married, and has four children who are all currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana and, as a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

George is a trader. He trades in hardware such as bags of cement, roofing sheets, building materials, etc. He sells in a store by the roadside in the community. George procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is 35 years old and is married to a police officer attached to a local area unit where they are living. She has three children all of whom are attending school. Aminata herself has never been to school as preference was given to boys in the area where she was born.

Aminata sells baby clothes along one of the main roads in the town.  She has been in this business for nineteen years. She started hawking (going door-to-door) but she now has a stall.

Aminata is determined to send all her children to school and to help her husband to construct a small house for the family. The loan she is requesting will help to raise the much needed funds to support her ambition.

Aminata has been a client with ARD for the last two years with a very good credit history. She is honest and very serious about her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothes

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Faustina works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in fried fish. She buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in her community, fries it and then sells to other retailers and food vendors. Faustina has been in business for over twenty years and wants to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es:
Keilyn T. N. tiene 21 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en China Kicha con su familia. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abarrotes para surtir, mercandería como arroz, frijoles, azucar, galletas, pan y refrescos. Ella quiere obtener mas ganancias con su pulpería. Es la primera vez Keilyn se financia con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido otra experiencía con credito.  Ella espera que pueda estudiar y ayudarle al papá ya que está un poco enfermo. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Keilyn T. N. is 21 years old, single and has no children. She lives in China Kicha with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as rice, beans, sugar, biscuits, bread and beverages. She hopes to improve her business and increase her revenue. This is the first time that Keilyn is requesting a loan to FUDECOSUR and it is her first experience with microfinance. She hopes to be able to complete her education and support her father, who has some health problem. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store restocking (rice, beans, biscuits, bread, beverages).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Beans

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: M. Antoinette est née en 1970 et vit depuis 15 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KOULETIO Sébastien, un mécanicien, Antoinette est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Antoinette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis 15 ans environs, Antoinette vend de la nourriture (« Ablo », aliment local, accompagné de haricot et de poissons frits) de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Antoinette s’approvisionne. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En ces périodes, Antoinette ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Antoinette M. was born in 1970. For 15 years she has lived in Fiégnon a Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Sébastien Kouletto, a mechanic, Antoinette has five children, all in school. The couple lives with their children and supports the family together. Antoinette never went to school. For about 15 years, she has sold food ("Ablo," a local dish served with beans and fried fish) from a moving cart. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Antoinette has already received two loans from ALIDé, loans which she repaid in full. At this time, she does not have sufficient funds to meet the demands of her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans and fish

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Theresa works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in utensils. She buys from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She travels to sell as well. Theresa has been in business for over ten years and wants to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is twenty-six years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Gifty works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a baker. She bakes bread and sells it to retailers. She also prepares and supplies pastries to other retailers in her community. Gifty has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish). She sells by the roadside. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mohamed J.

texts.en:
Mohamed J. G. is 29 years old. He has been married for six years and has two kids. The oldest has entered primary school. His wife, Hawanatu Mansaray, is a petty trader, selling textiles in the main market in the town. Mohamed sells food and drinks and has been in this business for the last ten years. He believes that if his business were improved it would provide him and his family their livelihood.

Mohamed has been a group client in the ARD Micro Credit Programme for the last twelve months with a good credit history. He wants to leave the group and take out an individual loan. Mohamed needs the loan so that he can increase and diversify his inventory so as to increase his sales and income. He is hardworking and is determined to educate his children from the increased profits of his business. He is also determined to construct a small house for the family on a piece of land he has already bought.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Joly

texts.fr: Z. Joly est née en 1964 et vit depuis environs 40 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KPALETE Hêlecou, un pêcheur, Joly est mère de quatre enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Fiégnon. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Joly n’a pas été à l’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Joly vend de la bouillie (faite à base d’amidon de maïs, accompagné de pâté et du sucre) de façon ambulante. Joly vend également du poisson à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Joly exerce cette activité depuis environs 15 ans et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Joly a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Joly sollicite ce troisième crédit dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Joly Z. was born in 1964. For about 40 years, she has lived in Fiégnon a Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Hêlecou Kpalete, a fisherman, Joly has four children, three of which she still provides for. All of the children are in school. The family lives together in Fiégnon. Together, the couple supports the family.

Joly did not go to school. To help her husband support the family, Joly sells mush made from a starch base and served with dough and sugar. She sells from a moving cart. Joly also sells fish in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has done this work for about 15 years and is on her third loan from ALIDé. She repaid her two previous loans in full. She is asking for a third loan in order to strengthen her business and better meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, sugar, and fish

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Grace works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish). She sells by the roadside. Grace is also a fish monger. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of general food products

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is fifty-two years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child who goes to school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Hannah is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She hawks locally and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for thirteen years and wants to expand her business. Hannah needs the loan to procure many kinds of cosmetics – body sprays, creams, pomade, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a fifty-eight-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Nana, like many other women in the community, works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She buys bags of rice from nearby communities. Nana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Niger Armando

texts.es: El señor Niger Armando T. G. tiene 45 años de edad vive en el Barrio Maria Auxiliadora es soltero y se dedica a la venta de mariscos tales como chacalines, camarones y ostiones etc...   Tras la muerte de su madre le ha costado el poder sentirse que sobrevive de manera independiente, en estos momentos el atraviesa una etapa de inseguridad hacia los negocios tras el fallecimiento de su mama es por esta razón que ahora desea realizar un cambio en su vida y obtener un crédito que le permita reinvertirlo en su negocio en  la compra de una mayor cantidad de mariscos que le favorezcan a su economía, espera que se le brinde un apoyo pues está decidido a trabajar duro para poder valerse por sí solo.
texts.en:
Niger Armando is 45 years old and lives in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood. He is single and sells seafood such as prawns, shrimp, oysters, etc... , He has had a hard time feeling self sufficient following his mother's death. Sometimes he can feel insecure about his business after his mother's passing, but is looking to change his life. He wants to get a loan to invest in his business by purchasing a greater amount of seafood in order to increase his income. He hopes he can receive your support since he has resolved to work hard to be self sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood to increase inventory

loans.name: Lissassi

texts.fr: K. Lissassi est née en 1949 et vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 50 ans. C’est une veuve, et mère de cinq enfants. Lissassi vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs besoins. Lissassi n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Lissassi vend de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs), accompagné de poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lissassi s’approvisionne en maïs à Dantokpa, et en poissons au bord de la mer. Lissassi exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Lissassi a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Lissassi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lissassi K. was born in 1949 and has lived for 50 years in the Flégnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow, and mother of five. She lives alone with her children, and is their sole provider. Lissassi has never been to school. To meet the needs of her children and herself, Lissassi sells akassa (local foodstuff made with corn starch) along with smoked fish, in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She buys her corn supplies in Dantokpa, and her fish at the seaside. Lissassi has been performing this activity for the past ten years and is now requestiing a loan from ALIDé. The two previous loans obtained from ALIDé have been fully reimbursed. She is requesting a third loan to increase her working capital and also her stock of supplies.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and fish

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Esi works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in utensils. She buys from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. She treks to sell in neighboring communities as well. Esi has been in business for two years and wants to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

Nuestra socia FANY tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos y son: Giovanna tiene 23 años y estudia para técnico de computación e informática y Andy tiene 15 años y esta en el cuarto grado de secundaria. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. La socia también es promotora de espectáculos folclóricos contrata artistas musicales como “Sonia Morales”, “Dina Paucar” y muchos más artistas. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más gaseosas y cervezas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
The member was born in the town of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis in the provincial department of Cuzco. She belong to the "Qori Orcco" Community Bank of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank means "Golden Hill" in the Quechua language. Cuzco was once the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of Colonial Peru. It was declared Heritage of Mankind and Archeological capital of the Americas.

Our member Fany is 43 years old and a single mother. Her children are Giovanna, a 23 year old who is studying towards her technical degree in IT and Andy, a 15 year old who is in the 10th grade. The member alternates her household chores with the sale of beer from her house. She is also a promoter of folk shows and hires musical artists such as Sonia Morales, Dina Paucar among many others. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to all hard work. Our member is a working mother and an interpreneur who provides for her family. She requests the loan to buy more sodas and beer.

The member is thankful for this opportunity and will comply with the scheduled repayments.

The city of Urcos is located 45km from Cuzco through the highway to Puno. It is a small village with a beautiful lagoon where, according to the legend, Huascar threw an enormous gold chain to prevent the Spaniards from taking it.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and beer

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Araba is a trader. She trades in secondhand clothes. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Araba has been in business for five years and wants to upgrade her business. Therefore, she wants the loan to procure bales of textile goods.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer is twenty-nine years of age. He is married and has one child, who is in school. He lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. The major occupation of the people is farming. However, Ebenezer is an electrician by profession. He has three apprentices who are in training. Ebenezer has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy electrical goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods in bulk

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger C. C. tiene 42 años, vive en union libre, y  tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 9 y 13 años respectivamente. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo con su familia de 4 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos para engorde y venderlos en comercios cercanos. El tiene mucho experiencia con cerdos. Es la primera vez don Roger se financia con FUDECOSUR. El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que tenga una vida mejor para el futuro, ya que pueden tener ingresos economicos. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Roger C. C. is 42 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 children that are his main priority. They are 9 and, 13 respectively. He lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his 4 member family. The loan he wants is for buying pigs to fatten and sell to nearby businesses. He has a lot of experience with pigs. This is Roger’s first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with formal banks. He hopes he will have a better life in the future, now that he can earn an income.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah is a trader. She trades in jewels. She hawks locally and travels to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants to expand her business. Sarah wants the loan to procure many kinds of jewels – earrings, necklaces, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar tiene 52 años de edad, su meta ha sido poder terminar su casa, ya que a muchos esfuerzos la construido toda de concreto para dar a su familia un techo digno, su esposa procreo siete hijos  solo uno estudia y ala vez trabaja en una librería para suplirse los gastos de sus estudios ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos económico para apoyarlo, don Julio trabaja como guarda de seguridad y su salario es bajo el ha construido su casa con los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, pues le hubiera hecho difícil construir su casa ya que todo el material de construcción es caro. Al inicio trabajaba como albañil y soldadura y luego de chofer en un camión, pero luego encontró este trabaja aunque es bajo el salario es fijo. Con el préstamo anterior pudo hacer las divisiones de los cuarto pero aun le falta hacer un espacio para la cocina, poner piso ya que es de tierra, repellar paredes y es una necesidad para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene para esto comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, reglones, tabla, y piso para comenzar hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar is 52 years old. His goal has been to finish his house, now that, with a lot of effort, it’s been built of concrete in order to give his family a proper roof. His wife had seven children, only one is studying and at the same time, he works in a book store to make up for his school expenses, since his parents do not have the economic resources to support him. Julio works as a security guard and his salary is low. He had constructed his house with financing from Afodenic, it was difficult to build his house, since all the construction materials are expensive. First, he was working as construction worker and welder, and then, as a truck driver but later he found this job. Although the salary is low, it’s a permanent job. With the previous loan, he could make the divisions between the bedrooms but he still needs to make a space for the kitchen, put down a floor since now it’s made of dirt and plaster the walls. It’s a necessity for the house to be in better hygienic conditions, so for this he will buy: stone, sand, cement, floorboards and flooring to start building.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, cement, flooring to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: K. Yvette vit depuis 45 ans au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à M’GBAVADE Germain, un couturier, Yvette est mère de deux enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Yvette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a 10 ans environs que Yvette mène comme activité, la vente de chaussure de façon ambulante. Yvette vend également de la nourriture à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Yvette s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yvette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever davantage le niveau de son activité, et de se faire une épargne.
texts.en:
Yvette K. has lived for 45 years in the district of Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a dressmaker, Germain M'Gbavade, Yvette is the mother of two children, one of which lives in her care. Both of her children attend school. Yvette lives with her children and husband. The couple shares the family expenses. Yvette did not attend school. For approximately the last 10 years, Yvette has sold shoes door-to-door. Yvette also sells food from her home. Yvette gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is an old client of ALIDé and has repaid her previous loans. Yvette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to earn some savings.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of shoes for resale

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku is fifty-four years of age. He is married and has four children, who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. The major occupation of the people is farming. Kwaku, however, is a carpenter by profession. He has two apprentices who are currently in training. Kwaku has been in business for nineteen years and wants a loan to buy wood and other materials for his work.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials for his work

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Martha del Socorro O. B., tiene 37 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte este es un Barrio que carece la seguridad y un buen ambiente familiar, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos, quienes tienen las edades de 21, 16 y 14 años de edad  el menor estudia y los otros dos trabajan por su cuenta, Doña Martha anhela el poder realizar mejoras en su hogar y así poder ofrecerles un ambiente optimo a toda su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 6 años, pues su modesto puesto de tortillas carece de las buenas condiciones para poder realizar su labores sobre todo cuando llega el invierno se moja toda y por esta razón solicito de un préstamo para poder realizar mejoras en su puesto de trabajo con el crédito planea comprar materiales de construcción tales como hierro, cemento y zinc. Esta será la primera etapa de estas mejoras que realizará, los beneficios que obtendrá tras estos cambios serian significativos puesto que podrá elaborar mas tortillas por que tendrá las facilidades para realizarlos, esto a largo plazo le beneficiara a todo la familia en un cambio sustancial económicamente y socialmente.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro O. B. is 37 years of age and lives in the Barrio Laureles Norte district. This is a district with precarious security and it is not the ideal family environment. She is a single mother of three children ages 21, 16 and 14. The youngest is attending school, while the two eldest are self-employed. Martha would like to perform some house improvements and so be able to offer her family a more confortable place to live. She has sold tortillas for six years, but her tortillas stand is now in bad condition and not adequate for the business, in particular during the winter season, when she gets completely wet because of the weather conditions. She is now requesting a loan to improve her working place; she will use it to buy construction materials, such as iron, cement and zinc. This will be the first step towards improvement, as the new conditions of her working place will allow her to prepare more tortillas and in the long term this will lead to a substantial financial and social change for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 55 years old and married, and has four children who are all currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. The main occupation of the people is fishing. However, Edward is a trader. He trades in hardware supplies, such as paints. He sells in a store by the roadside in the community. Edward procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy more hardware goods to sell

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin S. C. tiene 66 años, es casado, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo solo con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas para cría. La ayudará em que consequira ingresos cuando venda las crías. Don Agustin se dedica a la ganadería donde vende las crías de las vacas y así obtiene el ingreso, tiene mas de 10 años de estar en esta actividad.  Es la primera vez don Agustin se financia con FUDECOSUR  pero ha tenido otros creditos con coorperativos agricolas. En estos momentos que ya solo vive con la esposa, busca obtener un ingreso para salir adelante. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Agustin S. C. is 66, married, and has no children. He lives alone with his wife in Pueblo Nuevo. He is seeking a loan to buy cattle to breed so he can sell the calves to help him earn income. Agustin has earned his living selling calves for the past ten years. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR, but he has received prior loans from agricultural coops. Since he's just living with his wife, he's looking to earn a living so he can be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Imelda Patricia

texts.es:
Imelda S., joven propietaria de la tienda y miscelánea Mini Todo, ubicada en el barrio Los Girasoles de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, vive y trabaja  con su esposo, con quien comparte sus sueños personales como el de tener una microempresa bien surtida que permita incrementar constantemente su nivel de vida y prepararse para cuando tengan sus hijos.

Nacida en el tradicional y Guapachoso barrió Simon Bolívar de Barranquilla, donde su viuda madre la educó con sus hermanos, porque tenía un restaurante, del que fue desalojada y que continuó cerca al arroyo de Don Juan y al lado de un peligroso basurero. Esta fue la  razón por la cual, su madre la trasladó con sus hermanos donde su abuela materna para protegerlos y poder continuar con ese negocio, el que finalmente fracasó por los constantes ataques de los  ladrones y las inundaciones constantes del arroyo ya mencionado.

De esta  manera ingresó a la universidad sin el apoyo económico de su madre que lo había perdido todo, por eso habiendo vivido su experiencia de trabajo muy de cerca, se empleo en un restaurante y luego en una tienda, para sostener sus gastos y poder terminar su carrera, sin olvidar su gran sueño: “El de  tener un tienda bien surtida”.  Al terminar sus estudios, se casó, con Javier Pérez, empleado de una tienda, quien compartía su mismo sueño, por eso reunieron $2.000.000 para alquilar su primer negocio bien dotado de ranchos, víveres, y abarrotes, pero no alcanzaba a comprar su mercancía, es así como Arturo Martínez, asesor de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, la orienta y con su esposo participan el la capacitación empresarial y recibe su primer crédito por valor de $800.000, el cual es gradualmente aumentados al terminar de ser reembolsado, así recibió dos mas hasta llegar a $3.000.000. Con ellos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y adquirir vitrinas y estantería en general, ahora la tienda es propio  y tienen un gran desafío: “el de comprar una casa para no estar mudándose e invertir en adecuaciones en un espacio que aun no les pertenece, para ello  los esposos trabajan fuertemente y su amor es su máxima motivación.

En esta temporada  Imelda, planeo recibir un financiamiento por valor de $2.000.000  para comprar víveres, juguetes al por mayor y lograr buenos descuentos; el crédito será reembolsado en dos meses porque esta mercancía la venderá de contado. Esta pareja de esposos,  es  hoy un ejemplo de  unidad en el amor, persistencia y capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Imelda S. is the young owner of the “Mini Todo” store, located in the Los Girasoles neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. She lives and works with her husband, with whom she shares her dreams, such as having a well-stocked small business that will allow her to constantly improve her living conditions and prepare her for when they have children. She was born in the traditional and pretty Simón Bolivar neighborhood of Barranqilla, where her widowed mother raised her and her brothers. Her mother had a restaurant there, but she was removed from that location. She continued the business next to the Don Juan creek and next to a dangerous garbage dump. Her mother eventually took Imelda and her brothers to their maternal grandmother’s house to live, so that she could protect them and also continue with the business. The restaurant finally failed because of the constant attacks by thieves and the constant flooding from the previously mentioned creek. Because of these problems, Imelda enrolled in university without economic support from her mother, who had lost everything. Since she had had up-close work experience, she got a job in a restaurant and later in a store so that she could pay her expenses and finish her studies. She never forgot her dream, which was “To have a well-stocked store.” When she finished her studies, she married Javier Pérez, who worked in a store and shared the same dream. So, they scraped together 2,000,000 COP to rent their first business location, well stocked with snacks, staple foods, and grocery items. However, they didn’t have enough to buy some types of merchandise. Now Arturo Martínez, an advisor with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, advises Imelda and her husband. They participated in business training and received their first loan in the amount of 800,000 COP, which was gradually increased as the loans were repaid. That’s how they have received two more loans, reaching the amount of 3,000,000 COP. With the loans Imelda has managed to increase her working capital and buy vitrines and shelving. They now own the store and they have a big challenge: “To buy a house so we don’t have to keep moving,” and to invest in improvements in a space that isn’t theirs yet. In order to achieve this, the couple works hard and their love is their greatest motivation. During this season, Imelda planned to receive a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 COP to purchase staple foods and toys at wholesale price so that she can receive good discounts. The loan will be repaid in two months because this merchandise will be paid for up front by customers [as opposed to being paid for on credit]. This couple is an example of unity through love, persistence, and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase staple foods and toys at wholesale price.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is fifty-eight years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Rita works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in maize. Rita buys bags of maize from nearby towns and sells to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Juan F. con mucha dedicación atiende a diario su propio negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas de todo tipo distribuyéndolas a diferentes pulperías que le adquieren el producto a él. 

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Juan es muy trabajador porque inicia a laborar a partir de las Cinco de la mañana y cierra su establecimiento a las Diez de la noche diario siendo esta su actividad a la que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica para continuar mejorando sus ingresos y beneficiando a su familia que tanto ama. 

Con el crédito comprará las gaseosas para ofrecerla a sus clientes y lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
In the Department of Leon, Mr. Juan F. daily attends his own business with much dedication, selling soft drinks of all types. He also distributes them to different grocery stores who depend upon him.

It is important to stress that Juan is a very hard worker because he begins work daily at 5:00 in the morning and closes his establishment at 10:00 at night. This is the activity that he dedicates himself to, with great effort, to continue improving his income and benefiting his family which he loves so much.

With this loan he will buy soft drinks to offer his customers and obtain the satisfaction of each one of them.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is sixty-two years old, married, and has four children, some of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Francis is a proprietor of a private school. He started the school about three years ago and it is still in its beginning stages. He says he has hired a few staff members who work with him. Francis dreams of building the school to bigger and higher levels. He wants the loan to buy furnishings and equipment to improve the school.

loans.use: To buy furniture and equipment

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née en 1968 et réside depuis environs 20 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GONCALVES Soulemane, Laure est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Laure vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour se prendre en charge et venir en aide à son mari, Laure vend du poisson fumé à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Laure s’approvisionne au bord de la mer. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié déjà de deux crédits auprès de l’institution. Les deux crédits dont Laure a bénéficié ont été bien remboursés. Laure sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Laure A. was born in 1968 and has lived for approximately 20 years in the district of Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Soulemane Goncalves, Laure is the mother of two children, both whom attend school. Laure lives with her children and husband. The couple shares the family expenses. In order to provide for herself and to help her husband, Laure sells smoked fish at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Laure get her stock from the edge of the sea. She is an old client of ALIDé having been granted two previous loans from the institution. Her two previous loans were repaid in full. Laure is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fish

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La actividad pecuaria es una actividad que requiere de mucho esfuerzo y gran dedicación porque son trabajos que en muchas ocasiones provocan fatiga por la exposición al sol y el traslado de ganado en el municipio de Nagarote en León.

La señora Jaqueline Q. desde hace cinco años inició el trabajo de la actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de ganado como lo son terneros de desarrollo los que son cuidados por ella misma habiendo alcanzado experiencia en esto por su gran dedicación.

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de cinco terneros de desarrollo para proceder a su crianza y así extraerle la leche para comercializarla y obtener el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Raising livestock is an activity that requires a lot of effort and commitment because many times the work causes fatigue due to sun exposure and moving livestock in the municipality of Nagarote, Leon. Jaqueline Q. started this activity five years ago, raising cattle on her own allowed her to gain experience in the business due to her great commitment. The loan requested is to purchase five calves to raise and milk them, and this way make money to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase five calves

loans.name: Leonardo Melecio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, el señor Leonardo C. se dedica a trabajar muy arduamente todos los días vendiendo leña, sandías y pipianes todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Es importante destacar que él tiene una pequeña finca donde siembra algunas hortalizas y saca la leña pero para ir a esa finca y trasladar la leña y hortalizas se le es muy difícil porque está alejada y necesita un medio de transporte.

Esta es la razón por la que el señor Leonardo solicita un crédito ya que lo invertirá en la compra de un carretón y un caballo para utilizarlo en este trabajo y de esta manera trasladar los productos y darle el respectivo cuido y mantenimiento al caballo por medio de una buena alimentación y protección.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote, Leonardo Castellon works hard every day selling firewood, watermelons and nuts, starting early in the morning. It's important to mention that he has a small farm where he grows some vegetables and gets the firewood, however, to get to the farm and transport the wood and vegetables is difficult because it is far away and he needs a mode of transportation. This is why Leonardo requests a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of a horse and a cart to use on his job and this way transport the products and look after the horse by providing good nutrition and care.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse and a cart

loans.name: Anavi

texts.fr: F. Anavi est née en 1952 et vit depuis environs 57 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUTCHE Kocou, un pêcheur, Anavi est mère de trois enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Anavi n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 50 ans, Anavi vend du poisson fumé à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Anavi s’approvisionne au bord de la mer à Cotonou. Anavi a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédit à ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. Anavi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’agrandir davantage son activité. Anavi ambitionne devenir plus tard un grossiste, ce qui lui permettra de vendre à des semi-grossistes et des détaillants, ses produits.
texts.en:
Anavi F. was born in 1952 and has lived for approximately 57 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a fisherman, Kocou Noutche, Anavi is the mother of three children, one of whom is still in her care. All her children have been educated. The family lives in Fiégnon. The couple shares the family expenses. Anavi did not attend school. For almost 50 years, Anavi has been selling smoked fish at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Anavi gets her stock from the edge of the sea in Cotonou. Anavi has previously benefited from two ALIDé loans and repaid them both in full. Anavi is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her business. Anavi wishes to become a wholesaler one day, which will allow her to sell her products to semi-wholesalers and retail traders.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
EL señor Fernando Martínez, llego a la ciudad de Barranquilla  a la edad de 21 años, procedente de su pueblo natal, Polonuevo-Regencia, un corregimiento en el Dpto. de Bolívar, para  buscar un mejor porvenir, una vez terminó su bachillerato con el esfuerzo de sus padres. A ellos y sus 5 hermanos agradece todo el apoyo material y afectivo que le brindaron desde que cumplió 4 años de edad cuando sufrió poliomielitis dejándolo con dificultades para movilizarse rápidamente. Hoy teine un hogar conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos.

Fernando, es un hombre entusiasta y   optimista,   se inició como vendedor de dulces y cigarrillos con un capital que le presto su hermana, y que fue multiplicándolo  poco a poco. Cuando aumentó el volumen de clientes, hizo créditos a prestamistas de la calle, para diversificar el negocio ofreciendo  refrescos, fritos y mekatos, esta financiación le resultaba onerosa y  muchas personas en su barrio, le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, fue entonces que inició su relación con esta entidad, y con su primer crédito reemplazó los pasivos costosos. Actualmente se encuentra tramitando un segundo crédito, el cual va a usar para surtir con refrescos dulces y productos derivados de la harina de trigo sus estantes y va a mejorar la infraestructura su negocio con una cubierta, porque en invierno se moja y no tiene tiempo de recoger sus  muebles y enseres.  Sus principales clientes son los operarios de los talleres industriales que funcionan en este sector comercial que es altamente concurrido.

Fernando todos los días agradece a Dios  por el amor de la familia y el apoyo de  instituciones y de todas las personas que han creído en él. Para el futuro espera continuar siendo el eje de su hogar brindándoles  con su esposa, ejemplo y educación a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando Martínez came to the city of Barranquilla at the age of 21 to seek a better future. He is originally from Polonuevo-Regencia, a community in the department of Bolivar. He finished high school with support from his parents. He is grateful to his parents and 5 siblings for the material and emotional support they provided him after he suffered polio when he was 4 years old. He was left with difficulties that prevent him from moving very quickly. He now has his own family with his wife and three children. Fernando is an enthusiastic and optimistic man. He started a business selling sweets and cigarettes with money lent to him by his sister and it has grown, little by little. When he increased his number of customers, he took loans from street lenders to diversify his business of selling soft drinks, fried foods, and sweet breads. This type of financing turned out to be onerous and many people from his neighborhood told him about Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and that was when he began his association with this institution. With his first loan he repaid his previous, expensive loans. He is now requesting a second loan to purchase soft drinks, sweets, bread products, shelving, and he will improve the infrastructure of his business by putting a covering over it, because during the rainy season things get wet and he doesn’t have time to put away his furniture and other belongings. Most of his customers are workers in the industrial workshops that fill this busy commercial area of town. Fernando thanks God every day for the love of his family and the support of the institutions and all of the people who have believed in him. For the future, he hopes to continue being the pillar of strength for his household and, along with his wife, to provide a good example for his 3 children and to give them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sweets, bread products, shelving, and a tarp to cover his business location.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es:
Epifanio G. C. es un señor  de 42 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería

Desde hace 10 años don Epifanio se dedica a la ganadería, espeificamente en producción de leche.Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Don Epifanio considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad.

Actualmente don Epifanio desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones), para comprar 2 vacas y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Epifanio forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  tercer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Epifanio G. C. is 42 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a rural community of Costa Rica called San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala in the province of Alajuela. It is a rural community with a relatively large extension, which lies within the semi-mountainous topography of Costa Rica in Central America. The main activity in the community is centered on agriculture, especially the cultivation of grains, and livestock breeding to a lesser extent. 10 years ago, Epifanio works in this activity, in particular the production of milk. He is able to sell his products to the neighbours of his community, who seem very satisfied with the quality of the products he offers. In his particular situation, the demand is higher than what he can supply. Epifanio considers that thanks to the progress of this project, him and his family have slowly improved their life conditions and have been able to be part of the development of their community. Now Epifanio wishes to obtain a loan for 200,000 colones to purchase two cows and this way increase production. He knows that having more cows means more sacrifice and will require more work. However, his wishes to be a succesful entrepreneur and get his family ahead by improving their life conditions, motivates him to work harder. Epifanio belongs to the community credit enterprise of San Gabriel, one of the 100 organizations partners to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan and he says that with it he wishes to grow as an entrepreneur and get his business ahead. He also points out that thanks to this type of organizations and credit facilities he can focus more time to production actitvities.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Sr. Eduardo Vive en la Junta Pirai el se dedica ala a la cría de chanchos y agricultura para su comercializacion en los distintos mercados de la ciudad,y su esposa  se dedica ha la venta de productos de primera necesidad  en su domicilio y asi poder colaborar a sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar ellos trabajan en la misma zona desde hace muchos años. 
El destino del crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta y asi poder transportarse por distintos lugares de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in Junta Pirai and works raising pigs and in agriculture, he sells his products in the different markets of the city, her wife sells basic need products from home and this way they help their children that are in school and that have worked in the same area for many years. The purpose of this loan is to buy a motorcycle to go to different parts of the city offering his products.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino C. M. tiene 57 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 11, 15 y 18 años respectivamente. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo con su familia de 5 miembros. El esta solicitando un prestamo para hacerle una repacion a la casa ya que tiene un hijo enfermo y necesita ese lugar un buen estado. Este le ayudará para tener una mayor comodidad ya que es necesaria esa reparacion. El se dedico a la argricultura de granos basicos y a la ganadería. Hace mucho tiempo el ha tenido prestamos con FUDECOSUR y los creditos le han ayudado en salir adelante con su familia.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que pueda salir adelante y tener una mayor comodidad ya que se necesita. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Victorino C. M. is 57, married and has three children that are his priority, they are 11, 15 and 18 respectively. He lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his family of 5. He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his house because he has an ill son and needs the house to be in good conditions. This will help his son be more comfortable and makes the repairs necessary. He has worked in agriculture of basic grains and livestock. A long time ago he had loans with FUDECOSUR and the loans helped him get his family ahead. He hasn't had any other credits with Banks. He hopes to be able to get ahead and provide the comfort needed. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repairs to help ill son

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Con la responsabilidad de mantener en buen estado su vivienda, la señora María A. se dedica arduamente a trabajar en una empresa del municipio de el Guasaule y sus objetivos hoy en día son mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda puesto que ha estado en malas condiciones y ha iniciado la reconstrucción de dicha vivienda la cual está ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo.

Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que es el sueño que ha tenido y ahora lo hará realidad gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación en su trabajo.
texts.en:
With the responsibility of maintaining her house in good condition, Mrs. Maria A. dedicates herself arduously to work in an enterprise in the Municipality of Guasaule. Her objective today is to improve conditions in her home, which has fallen into bad condition. She has initiated reconstruction of her house, located in the Municipality of Somotillo.

It is important to point out that she is a very hard worker and has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to invest in purchasing construction materials to carry out these home improvements, which is the dream she has had and now, she will realize, thanks to her great effort and dedication to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO REBUILD HER HOME

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jabino Gilberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Jabino Gilberto C. labora a diario con el fin de ver realizado su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda iniciando a reconstruirla en parte porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ha requerido de mucha inversión para tenerla en mejores condiciones y que preste mayor seguridad.

El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar a su obra y así beneficiar directamente tanto a su cónyuge como a sus cuatro hijos que están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo and the department of Chinandega, Jabino Gilberto C. works daily with the aim to see his dream of improving his living conditions realized. It will begin with reconstructing part of the house because it has been in bad condition and has required a lot of investment to have better conditions and give it greater security. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy the construction materials to allow him to begin the work and will directly benefit his spouse and four children who he is responsible for.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
Diego Armando M. R. es un joven de 29 años de edad quien vive con su mamá y su hermano. Ellos viven  en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Desde hace tiempo Diego sea dedica a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado piña anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Diego es un micro crédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Diego es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Diego Armando M. R. is a young man of 29 who lives with his mother and brother. They live in a community called El Saíno de Pital located in the province of Alajuela. The community's main productive activities are cattle farming and agriculture. The main focus is the cultivation of pineapple which is sold mainly on the international market. For this reason, the community's development has grown in recent years generating a great demand for products and services, which helps to mitigate the effect of immigration. For some time Diego has focussed on pineapple planting, therefore, he says that he has enough experience in the care and maintenance of this kind of cultivation. He has a plot of land on which he has previously planted pineapple and it has given him very good results at distribution time, therefore he wants to expand his plantation, since thanks to this business his family's quality of life has improved considerably. The micro loan Diego is asking for currently is ¢300,000 (three hundred thousand colones), to buy baby pineapple plants and various supplies to give the best possible maintenance and care to his crop, so that in the end he will be able to be rewarded and have a very good output. Diego is a member of the Luz del Futuro Saino Communal Bank, one of the 100 organanizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. He also acknowledges that thanks to this type of organization and means of providing credit he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to maintain and plant pineapple

loans.name: Ana Rocio

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Ahorro está formado por un grupo de mujeres alegres, carismáticas y  triunfadoras que  buscan la manera de salir adelante siempre con una sonrisa y siendo visionarias de un mejor futuro para ellas y su familia saliendo avante    ante las dificultades que la vida les presenta en su día a día, todas  viven en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad que se caracteriza  por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, proclamada también como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su belleza natural, incomparable  arquitectura de  su centro histórico.

Ana Aucapiña es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro  hace dos  años, vive en el sector Cristo del Consuelo  en la urbe cuencana, tiene 21 años de edad es soltera  y vive con sus padres, actualmente  estudia en una academia de belleza que está casi por culminar sus estudios, la casa de sus padres es propia y colabora económicamente en lo que puede en con ellos.

Ana se dedica a la elaboración de Artesanías como las cabuyas (sogas) que son elaboradas de  totoras (plantas), este arte le enseñó su mamá  y lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad que se ha convertido en un negocio familiar  puesto que cada miembro de la familia elabora diferentes artesanías,  sus actividades inician a  las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y por la tarde asiste a clases en su academia.

 Los préstamos recibidos ha invertido para incrementar su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar cabuya para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Su mayor sueño es montar su propio gabinete.
texts.en:
“The Savings” communal bank is composed of a group of happy, charismatic, even triumphant women who always seek a way to get ahead with a smile. They have visions of a better future for them and their families, despite the difficulties that life presents from day to day. They all live in the city of Cuenca, the 3rd most important city in Ecuador. It has been declared a part of the “cultural patrimony of humanity” for its natural beauty and the incomparable architecture of the historic center.

Ana Aucapiña has been a member of the bank for 2 years, and lives in the Cristo del Consuelo sector of Cuenca. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. At present, she studies in the beauty academy and is nearly finished with her studies. The parents own their home and she collaborates with them economically as much as she can.

Ana makes artisan crafts, especially cords elaborated from the “totora” plant. Her mother taught her the art and she has been doing this for 8 years. Artisanry has become a family business, since each member has learned a different artisan art. Her activities begin at 6:00 in the morning and continue until 12:00 noon, then afternoons she attends classes at the academy.

Her previous loans have been invested to expand her business and with this new loan, she will buy “totora” fiber to be used in her artisan craft. Her big dream is to build her own dressing-room.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FIBER TO MAKE CORDS TO SELL

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La Sra. Vicenta C. V. vive el la localidad de Santa Rita su actividad principal es de vender materiales de construcción como ser arena, ladrillos, cemento, yeso, etc. junto con su esposo ella tambien se dedica labores de la casa y ala educación de sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para abastecerse de material de construccion y asi incrementar su capital de trabajo para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. Vicenta C. V. lives in the town of Santa Rita. Her primary work is selling construction materials such as sand, bricks, cement, plaster, etc. with her husband she does housework and educates her sons. The requested loan will be used to stock up on construction materials and, as a result, increase her working capital and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Construction Materials

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
Felisa T. M. es una señora de 56 años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Doña Felisa trabajó por mucho tiempo en una planta exportadora de piña, pero ahora se dedica a las labores del hogar y a vender platillos de comida a las personas de su comunidad. Ella quiere establecer un nuevo negocio de venta de productos para el hogar, con el inicio de este negocio espera tener mayores ingresos para su hogar. Comenta que es una señora muy conocida en su comunidad por eso espera que sus vecinos la apoyen en su nuevo negocio.

Actualmente doña Felisa está solicitando un microcrédito por un monto de ¢200.000 (Doscientos mil colones) para comprar y vender mercadería en su pueblo. Con el préstamo que está solicitando ella espera mejorar la condición económica de su familia. 

Doña Felisa es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su octavo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Felisa T. M. is a 56 year old lady who lives with her husband in the community of El Saino de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela, her primary activities are farming, including growing pineapples that are mainly commercialized internationally. This is the reason why the community has been growing in the last few years generating a higher demand for products and services, which helps stop the emigration effect. Felisa worked for a long time in the pineapple export plant, but she now works at home selling food to people in her community. She wants to establish a new business selling home products, with the start of this business she hopes to bring more income home. She mentions to be a lady very well known in her community, which is a reason why she hopes that her neighbors will support her in her new business. Felisa is currently requesting a loan for 200,000 colones to buy and sell merchandise in her town. With the loan requested she hopes to improve the economic conditions of her family. Felisa is a member of the community credit enterprise Luz del Futuro Saino, one of the 100 organizations members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her eighth loan and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She also points out that thanks to this type of organizations and credit facilities she can dedicate more time to work activities.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad, el señor Marcelino R. se dedica a su actividad de triciclo trasladando personas de un lugar a otro en su propio triciclo laborando a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana con el fin de obtener el ingreso para llevarlo a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

El crédito lo está solicitando porque necesita comprar materiales de construcción porque ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello le urge obtener dichos materiales porque ha decidido beneficiar a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus cinco hijos que están bajo su responsabilidad.
Espera que el crédito le será otorgado sin problemas y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
At 58 years old, Marcelino Ramirez works transporting people in his three-wheel from one place to another, working everyday starting early in the morning with the purpose to obtain income to bring home and help his family in need. The loan requested is to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house and this way benefit his wife and five children that are his responsibility. He hopes the loan is provided without any problems and this way he will improve his family's quality of life and his own.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Cesar Andrés

texts.es:
Cesar Andrés V. B. es un joven de 21 años de edad quien vive en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Cesar trabaja en una planta exportadora de piña, pero los fines de semana y días libres se dedica a su plantación la cual la tiene en un terreno alquilado. Su deseo de superación lo ha llevado a trabajar horas extras para así tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para el como para su pequeña  hija.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita es un micro crédito de ¢530,000 (quinientos treinta mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, fertilizantes y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

César es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Cesar Andrés V. B. is a young man 21 years old who lives in a community called El Saíno de Pital located in the province of Alajuela. The community's primary productive activity is cattle farming and agriculture with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapple, which is sold mostly in international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has been growing the last few years generating a large demand for the products and services which is helping mitigate the effect of immigration. Cesar works in a pineapple exportation plant, but on his weekends and free days he works on his plantation which is on rented land. His wish is to overcome the need to work extra hours to have a better quality of life both for him and for his young daughter. The micro credit loan he is asking for right now is for ¢530,000 (five hundred thirty thousand colones), to buy baby pineapple plants, fertilizers and different consumables to give the best maintenance and assistance possible to his crops. In the end he will be able to be rewarded and will have a much better production. César is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. It will be his first loan and he requests it with the hope of continuing to grow both on a personal and economic level. Also, he emphasizes his thanks for this type of organization and all the credit facilitators that allow him to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumabels to maintain and plant pineapple

loans.name: Susana Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Susana M. es una dama muy trabajadora que tiene el deber de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar a los cuales debe brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para que se desarrollen y sobre todo brindarles un techo digno donde vivir.

Actualmente, lleva a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda y por este motivo es que ha duplicado sus esfuerzos en el trabajo para lograr esta meta de mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y sus hijos a los que tanto ama.

Por estas razones es que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para que de esta manera logre salir adelante en su desarrollo familiar brindando un techo digno y seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susan is a hard-working woman. She is responsible for two school-age children. She needs to provide them with their basic needs as well as a decent home to live in. She would like to renovate her home. In order to do this she is dobbling her efforts at work so that she can achieve her goal of providing for a better quality of life for herself and her children that she loves so much. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy construction materials. In this manner she can move forward with her family by providing them with a decent roof over their heads and security.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy construction materials.
