Her kiosk is located right at the entrance to the marketplace which makes it a favorable spot for many potential customers. Ludmila has been working in this sphere of trade for 5 years. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 - 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ludmila has proved to be a reliable borrower with a stable business. She is always very customer-friendly. This time she is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise for the holiday season. Ludmila owns two vending locations and is hoping to re-stock them with inventory using the current loan.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has a grown daughter, Anastasia. She lives and works in Melitopol. Yelena owns a well-equipped vending kiosk in one of the local marketplaces where she sells men’s outer wear. She has been working in this sphere of trade for 12 years. Currently, she has 100,000 Grivnyas in stock. Her monthly net profit is about 9,000 Grivnyas. 

Yelena is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise. She is hoping to continue developing her business. Yelena is planning to use the generated profit to do some remodeling in her apartment and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita B. is a resident of Bhakepati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Nabin B. is a tailor. Her son is just a year old.

Mrs. B. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting for Rs 20000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her income to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: to buy supplies of grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana Bhushal and her husband Mr. Shyam Bhushal both are tailors in the village of Bhakepati, Kathmandu. Tailoring is their traditional work. They learned the tailoring trade from their parents. They make custom fitted ladies dresses like kurta sulwar which are very popular with Nepali woman.

Mrs. Bhushal is currently asking for Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.Mrs. Bhushal lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and her husband

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati A. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.  Mrs. A. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son started to attend university this year and her daughter is studying in grade 6.

Both Mrs. A. and Mr. A. are engaged in a grocery store business. They opened their grocery store few years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. They sell different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, noodles, etc.

Now, Mrs. Achary is requesting a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy grocery supplies for their shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies for their shop

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana D., a resident of Chapagaun, lives in a single family with her husband and one daughter. Chapagaun is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband Mr. Sankhar D. works in a private office and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming and has four goats in her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrading the living standard of her family. She is requesting her third loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy more goats and grain for goat feed.

loans.use: to buy young goats and feed

loans.name: Bishnu Maiya

texts.en:
Bishnu Maiya D. is a grocery shopkeeper in Chapagaun, lalitpur. She opened her grocery store five years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her grocery store. She feels proud to help her husband in fulfilling the need of family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits etc in her shop. Now, she is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy different verities of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. D. lives in single family with her husband and three children. Her husband is engaged in agricultural work. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is studying in grade 12. Her older daughter is studying in grade 11 and the younger daughter is studying in grade 8.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Nanu

texts.en: Mrs. Nanu N. and her husband, Mr. Jit Bahadur N., both are tailors in the village of Bhakepati, Kathmndu. They have their own tailoring shop. Tailoring is their traditional work, which they learned from their forefathers. They especially make custom-fitted ladies wear, like kurta sulwar, pants and shirts, which are very popular in Nepal. They seek a loan of Rs 25000 to buy raw materials for their tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati K. lives in Bhakepati, which is located in Kathmandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing village of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Kutuwal lives in a single-family dwelling with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Kumar, is a teacher in local school. Both her sons are now studying.

Mrs. Kutuwal opened a grocery shop 5 years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food in her shop, such as noodles, rice, biscuits and other goods. She will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her income to give a better education to her sons.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita B. lives with her husband and one son, who has attained grade 9. Her husband’s name is Pradeep B..

Both Mr. and Mrs. B. have been doing tailoring work, which they learned from their forefathers. They make school uniforms for both boys and girls. They prefer to make popular ladies clothes, like kurta sulwal, blouses, long dresses, and other clothes.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 25000.00 loan to buy raw materials like cotton cloth for the tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhawani M. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 5 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies clothes, like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. Bhawani took a 6-month training course in tailoring near her town.

She plans to use this loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. Her economic condition is very low to fulfill the basic needs of her family, so she need the loan to expand her business to earn more profit to fulfill her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita S. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Tangal. She opened her grocery store few years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. In her shop she sells different types of grocery goods, such as rice, bitten rice, snacks, etc. She uses her income to fulfill the needs of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. S. lives in single-family residence with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Babu Raja, works in his own small business, and her son is in pre-primary school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn P. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Arlyn owns and operates a business selling vegetables and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2005, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn T. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 33 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Emelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2004, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her pig-raising business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel S. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba. He is 59 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Marcel owns and operates a business making and selling letchon (Philippine-style roasted pig) in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2007, Marcel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marcel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for the renovation of his house. Part of the loan proceeds will be added as capital to his existing business. This loan will be his 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for the renovation of his house plus additional capital for his business

loans.name: Armie

texts.en: Armie G. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Armie owns and operates business producing rice on their own rice field. However, in addition to the earnings from their farm, her main source of income comes from selling bananas in the local community. Armie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2007, Armie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Armie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and chemicals. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Plaridel. She is 60 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Phoebe's main source of income comes from her pension of approximately 8,000 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2007, Phoebe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Phoebe is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for the repair of her house. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for her house renovation

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr.  Juan A. García  tiene 20 años es soltero  vive con su madre la Sra. Carmela García  que tiene 65 años ancianita, él  mantiene a su madre con su trabajo, el padre falleció hace 20 años con una enfermedad  desconocido,  Juan se dedica a producir  papa, zapallo tiene experiencia en el manejo de cultivos y los tratamientos fitosanitarios, los insumos agrícolas compra de la feria de colomi, la semilla de papa, la semilla de zapallo y los agroquímicos.
 
El Sr. Juan vive en la zona de Corani a 35 km de colomi, esta en la provincia chapare en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona, en la visita a la zona  se ha visto la construcción de su casa y es muy precaria, pero la zona es muy apta para la siembra de papa y zapallo.

El Sr. Juan nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de papa y  zapallo ampliar los cultivos y  con la ganancia  construir una vivienda adecuada y cumplir con los sueños de su madre de tener casa propia, el Juan piensa tener familia y para eso debe  tener casa propia en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Juan A. García is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother Carmela García who is 65 years old. He supports his mother through his work, his father passed away 20 years ago from an unknown illness. Juan produces potato and pumpkin. He has experience in cultivation and plant health treatments. He buys his agricultural supplies from the market at Colomi - potato seed, pumpkin seed and agrichemicals. Juan lives in the Corani zone 35km from Colomi, in the Chapare province of Cochabamba. This zone is quite remote from the city and therefore it is difficult for them to go to the banks for a loan. This is why Cidre had the initiative to go to this zone. On the zone visit they saw that the construction of his house is very unstable, but the zone is very suitable for growing potato and pumpkin. Juan tells us that his greatest dream is to continue producing potato and pumpkin, to increase the crop and with the profits build a suitable house and fulfill his mother's dreams of having her own home. Juan is thinking of having a family and therefore needs to have his own home in the best condition possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for growing Potato and Pumpkin

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor Leonidas tiene 47 años de edad, hombre muy esforzado y trabajador, casado, con tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, dueño de taxi el cual trabajaba y ahorraba, lo que lo llevo a comprar otro taxi y con financiamiento un camión, lleva siete años trabajando en su negocio el cual se siente contento por todos sus logros el cual podrá dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida. Es su décimo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de llantas para su camión. Ya que es una necesidad por que están muy gastada las llantas para evitar cualquier incidente. Los dos taxis que tiene paga a cadetes para que le trabajen pero en un futuro quiere cambiar las unidades para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible crecer su negocio el cual es de mucho beneficio para poder sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana a si como poder dar los estudios a sus hijos para que logren una mejor estabilidad en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 47 years old and is a hard-working man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He worked driving a taxi which he owned, and saved money. This allowed him to buy another taxi and, with financing, a truck. He has been working at his business for seven years and is happy that with his success he can provide a better life for his family. This is his tenth loan, which he will invest in a set of tires for his truck. This is much needed because the current tires are too worn to avoid problems. He pays two drivers to work for him driving his taxis but in the future he wants to change vehicles in order to provide better service to his customers. He thanks the lending institution for making it possible for his business to grow. This is very helpful for covering everyday expenses, such as being able to send his children to school so that they will have more stability in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires for his truck in order to provide better service and protect his safety

loans.name: Silvia Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Silvia Mercedes es una mujer de 47 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos los cuales el mayor trabaja y dos estudian, su trabajo ha sido la costura desde hace varios años, primeramente trabajo en familia, luego en un taller de costura, y luego se independizo haciendo sus costuras en su casa, pero luego las costuras y las ventas bajaron lo que la llevo a tomar la decisión de buscar trabajo en zona franca de lunes a viernes para tener un ingreso fijo, y los fines de semana coser en su casa para poder tener otro ingreso ya que tiene que cubrir la alimentación, educación y todos los gastos por que es madre soltera y tiene que esforzarse para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su hogar. Con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, para continuar construcción de  un muro y poder tener mejores condiciones de seguridad contra la delincuencia que asecha día a día en su barrio. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder comprar una maquina de coser moderna para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Todo esto gracias al financiamiento otorgado por Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el bienestar a muchas familias Nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Silvia Mercedes is a 47 year old woman who lives with her three children. The oldest works and the other two are in school. She has worked as a seamstress for many years, first for her family, then in a workshop, and finally she struck out on her own sewing from her home. Later a fall in orders and sales led her to make the decision to look for work in a free trade zone from Monday to Friday, in order to have a steady income. On the weekends she sews from home to have another source of income. This way she can cover the cost of food, schooling, and all other expenses. Since she is a single mother she must work hard in order to satisfy the household needs. With this loan she wants to buy construction materials such as stone, cement, sand and iron in order to continue the construction of a wall. This will allow her to improve the security of her home against the delinquency that she sees every day in her neighborhood. Her short-term plans are to buy a modern sewing machine in order to provide better service to her clients. All of this is possible thanks to the financing provided by Afodenic, which she thanks for the welfare of many Nicaraguan families.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to finish the construction of a wall.

loans.name: Eveling Violeta

texts.es: La señora Eveling tiene 51 años de edad, casada, procreo  cinco hijos, actualmente reside en un barrio Villa Reconciliación, se dedica a la venta de cosmético el cual vende al contado y al crédito, también alquila un cuarto lo cual ha sido de mucho para poder pagar gastos en su hogar, su esposo trabaja en construcción pero en el país de Costa rica  junto  a mis cuatro hijos están allá trabajando por que se hizo difícil el trabajo aquí en nuestro país y teníamos que buscar una solución aunque muy duro pero hay que salir adelante por que hay necesidades de alimentación, pagos de agua, luz, vestimenta entre otros, solo una hija esta con conmigo. Este préstamo lo quiere para comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hiero y terminar de construir un muro que parte lo tiene con zinc ya que es de mucha necesidad para mejor seguridad ya que solo vivimos dos mujeres que espero que pronto regrese mi familia. Da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible las mejoras  a su vivienda con el crédito anterior mejoro el cuarto del alquiler para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
Eveling is 51 years old, is married, and has raised five children. She currently lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She works selling cosmetics, which she sells both for direct payment and on credit. She also rents out a room, which has been a great help to be able to pay household expenses. Her husband works in construction, but in Costa Rica, along with her four sons. They are working there because the work situation became difficult in their country they had to find a solution. Although it is very hard, one has to keep going because there are needs like food, payments for water and electricity, and clothing, among other things. Only one daughter lives with her. She wants this loan in order to buy stone, sand, cement and iron, to finish building a wall that is partly built out of zinc. This is very necessary because they are two women living alone. She hopes that her family returns soon. She thanks the lending institution for making it possible to improve her home with a previous loan. She improved the rented room, in order to provide a better service to her renters. This has been very beneficial.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to finish a wall that she has

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a dos hermanos, en el distrito de Cura Mori, ubicado en la región Piura, a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de cinco años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio. Usualmente cría pollos, patos, pavos, carneros y cuyes los cuales comercializa entre los negociantes que eventualmente visitan la zona. Este negocio le provee los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Rosa desea engordar a sus animales para ofrecerlos durante esta temporada de Navidad y Año Nuevo, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.

Su más grande anhelo es ayudar a sus padres a mejorar la casa en donde viven y seguir adelante con su negocio, ella es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old, is single and lives in her parents’ house with her two siblings in the district of Cura Mori, located in the Plura region, which is three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years, she has raised and sold animals in her home. Usually, she raises chickens, ducks, turkeys, sheep and guinea pigs, which she sells to the traders who frequently visit her area. This business provides the income necessary to pay for her personal expenses and to help with the household’s finances. Rosa wants to fatten her animals so that she can sell them during the holiday season, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. Because of this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN, which she wants to invest in the purchase of nutritious food for her animals. Her greatest desire is to help her parents improve their home and to go forward with her business. She is a responsible and hard-working woman and is very devoted to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritious food for her animals

loans.name: María Martina

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo trabaja como obrero en un molino de arroz de la ciudad y lo que gana no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, hace dos años empezó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo. Gracias a este negocio su familia ha podico gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y ahora, poco a poco, están saliendo adelante.

El tiempo que lleva en el negocio y la calidad de trato que brinda a sus clientes han hecho que María sea muy conocida entre los vecinos de su zona, actualmente tiene un grupo de clientes ya fidelizados que aprovechan cada campaña para adquirir sus productos. María ha pensado en ampliar su negocio por temporada navideña pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para invertir en la compra del stock que necesita, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su ás grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales exitosos en el futuro. Ella es una madre responsable, trabajadora y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband works in a mill in the city and does not earn enough to pay for all of the household’s expenses. Two years ago, María began selling beauty products by catalogue. Thanks to this business, her family has been able to enjoy a better quality of life and, now, little by little, they are going forward. Because of her attitude and the deals that she offers to her clients, María is very well-known among her neighbors. At present, she has a group of loyal clients who take advantage of each opportunity to buy her products. María has planned to grow her business for the Christmas season, but she doesn’t have enough capital to invest in the purchase of the stock that she needs. Because of this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN. Her greatest desire is to see her children become successful professionals in the future. She is a responsible and hard-working mother, who always helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to grow her business

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 8 años de edad en el caserío Punto 9, distrito de Mochumí, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. Usualmente cría pavos, patos, chanchos y pollos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque o a compradores ocasionales que llegan a buscarla. Este negocio constituye una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como operario en un taller de mecánica de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

La temporada de fiestas de fin de año hace que la demanda por sus animales crezca, por este motivo ella planea comprar más alimento para engordarlos pronto y comprar más animales para no desabastacerse. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación. Ella es una madre trabajadora, responsable y muy estimada por lo vecinos de la zona por donde vive.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three children, who are 13, 11 and 8 years old, in the Punto 9 village, in the district of Mochumí, which is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, she has raised and sold animals. Usually, she raises turkeys, ducks, pigs and chickens, which she fattens and later sells in the market in the city of Lambayeque or occasionally to traders who come to find her. This business is an important source of income for her family, since her husband works as an operator in a workshop in the city of Lambayeque. Because of the holiday season, the demand for her animals has grown. Because of this, she plans to buy more food to fatten them soon and to buy animals to meet this demand. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire is to offer her children a good education. She is a hard-working and responsible mother, who is respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Blanca Irene

texts.es:
Blanca es soltera, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al servicio de peluquería y maquillaje. Aprendió esta profesión en un instituto de la ciudad de Lambayeque y actualmente se vale de sus conocimientos para ganarse la vida y ayudar a sus padres. 

Blanca tiene un ambiente preparado en una parte de su casa donde planea hacer funcionar su peluquería y actualmente cuenta con la mayoría de utilería para realizar esta actividad. Su negocio es muy frecuentado por clientes de la zona que acuden a ella gracias a la calidad de su trabajo y a los precios cómodos que ofrece. 

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de algunos accesorios e insumos que le faltan (shampoo y tintes) así como en la mejora del ambiente destinado para su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es perfeccionar poco a poco sus técnicas y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella es una mujer bastante humilde en su trato pero que tiene bastante voluntad para trabajar y cooperar con sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Blanca is single, 30, and lives in her parents' house in the Muy Finca area in the district of Mochumí, situated 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years, she has been working in hairdressing and make-up services. She learnt this profession at an institute in the city of Lambayeque and currently uses her knowledge to earn a living and help her parents. Blanca has a room prepared in a part of her house where she plans to run her hairdressers and currently she counts on the majority of her equipment to undertake this activity. Her business is very popular among clients in the area who turn to her, thanks to the quality of her work and the reasonable prices she offers. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time of 600 new soles which she plans to invest in buying various accessories and supplies that she lacks (shampoo and dyes), and thereby improve the room intended for her business. Blanca's greatest desire is to perfect her techniques bit by bit and to grow her business. She is a humble woman but is keen to work and to cooperate with her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories and supplies to establish her hairdressers.

loans.name: Rosa Medalit

texts.es:
Rosa tiene19 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su pequeña hija en casa de su familia, ubicada en el sector Tranca Fanupe, en el distrito de Mórrope, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su hija hizo que empezara a comercializar animales, lleva aproximadamente un año es esta actividad. Usualmente cría pavos, patos, chanchos, cuyes y pollos para luego venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo) o a los compradores ocasionales que visitan su caserío.

La demanda por los animales que ofrece ha subido durante la presente temporada de fiestas de fin de año, Rosa desea engordarlos para que tengan una rápida comercialización pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar el alimento balanceado que necesita por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre que lucha diariamente por sacar adelante a su hija. Su más grande anhelo es verla convertida en una persona de bien y en una profesional exitosa por lo que planea brindarle una educación de calidad y una buena crianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is 19 years old, a single mother and lives together with her small daughter in the family home, situated in the Tranca Fanupe area in the district of Mórrope, an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Given the need to get ahead for her daughter, she started to market animals and has been carrying out this activity for approximately a year. Usually she raises turkeys, ducks, pigs, guinea-pigs and chickens to sell in the Moshoqueque market (the main market in the city of Chiclayo) or to buyers who occasionally visit her house.

The demand for the animals she sells has risen in recent festive times around the end of the year. Rosa would like to fatten up her animals to sell them quickly but she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy the balanced food that she needs, so it is necessary for her to request a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

Rosa is a mother who fights daily for her daughter to get ahead. Her greatest wish is to see her daughter become a good person and a successful professional, and for that reason she plans to offer her a quality education and a good upbringing.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced food to raise and sell animals.

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Felix Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix Jose R. P.  es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud lleva 10 años de trabajar en esa institucion desempeñandose como guarda de seguridad. El sr. Felix  va a usar el credito para compra de  cemento, piedrín, arena, hierro y zinc, pra construir un cuarto para sus dos hijos.
El espera que con este Nuevo cuarto sus hijos podran gosar de privacidad.
Felix es casado con 2 hijos los cuales estan a su cargo, y estan en edad escolar.
Este es el primer credito que el sr. Felix a tenido con CEPRODEL.
Felix dijo que este financiamiento otorgado por CEPRODEL le a ayudado mucho por lo que ahora contara con un Nuevo cuarto para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Mr Felix Jose R. P. is a hard worker at the Centro de Insumos Para la Salud (Centre of Health Supplies), where he has worked for 10 years as a security guard. He will use the loan to buy cement, rocks, sand, iron and zinc to build a room for his two children. He hopes that with the new room, his children will be able to enjoy more privacy.

Felix is married with two children of school age in his care. This will be Felix's first loan with CEPRODEL. Felix says that this loan awarded by CEPRODEL will help him a lot now as he will be able to build the room for his two children.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, rocks, sand, iron and zinc.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario Jose M. C. es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud lleva 5 años de trabajar en esa institucion desempeñandose como oficinista. El sr. M. va a usar el credito para compra de ceramica, arena y cemento pora la casa.
Por que ahora no tiene piso y asi los niños no podran ensuciarse mas.
El sr. Mario es casado y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y este todavia esta a su cargo.
Este el primer credito que el sr. Mario a tenido con CEPRODEL.

Mario dijo que este préstamo fue de mucha ayuda para su familia por lo que antes su casa de habitación era de concreto la parte del piso.
texts.en:
Mr Mario Jose M. C. is a hard worker at the Centro de Insumos Para la Salud (Centre for Health Supplies) where he has worked for 5 years in the office. Mr M. will use the loan to buy ceramics, sand and cement for his house to avoid the children getting dirty because he currently doesn't have a floor.

Mario is married and has one son who is still in his care. This is the first loan that Mario has taken out with CEPRODEL and he says that the loan will help his family a lot because previously in his house there was concrete in place of the floor.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ceramics, cement and sand.

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Ervin Francisco Hernández, es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud lleva 8 años de trabajar en esa institucion desempeñandose como responsible de bodega. El sr. Ervin Francisco  va a usar el credito Para Compra de  cemento, piedrín, arena, hierro, zinc y madera para la construcción  de las paredes de la cocina de la casa.
Por que ahora no cuenta con suficiente recursos.
El sr. Ervin Francisco es casado y tiene 2 hijo a su cargo y este todavia esta a su cargo y en edad escolar.
Este el primer credito que el sr. Mario a tenido con CEPRODEL.
Ervin Francisco dijo, que los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado en gran parte ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación la cual me hacia falta construir las paredes de la cocina, por lo que antes estaba cerrada con tablas de madera
texts.en:
Mr Ervin Francisco H.is a hard worker at the Centro de Insumos Para la Salud (Centre for Health Supplies) where he has worked for 8 years with responsibility for the grocery store. Ervin Francisco will use the loan to buy cement, rocks, sand, iron, zinc and wood to construct walls for the kitchen in his house, as he currently doesn't have enough resources. Ervin Francisco is married with two children who are of school age and still in his care. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He says that the financing that CEPRODEL has awarded has helped him a lot as he will be able to improve his house, whose kitchen lacked walls and was previously enclosed by wooden boards.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, rocks, sand, iron, zinc and wood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar M. is 52-year-old farmer who breeds and sells cattle in the central livestock bazaar. He is a retired doctor, but his pension is not even enough to cover basic family needs. Yashar is married and has 3 children. He started animal breeding 15 years ago as an additional source of income but now this business is the main source of income for his family. Yashar applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more cattle and increase his general income. Yashar thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir M. is an ordinary man from the small village of Imishli. He is a very responsible person who, since his youth, has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family – a wife and three children. Sabir needs to purchase calves to breed and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat.

Once he has these products from his herd, he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Sabir is turning to you for support that would permit him to continue developing his business. He applied for a loan of 1600 Azerbaijani manats to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Wilber José

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilber José N. Aragón  es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud desde el año 2005 lleva 4 años laborando para esa institución, como responsable de bodega numero 3.El  sr. Wilber Jose va a usar el crédito para la compra: de  cemento, piedrín, arena y Cerámica, por lo que me hacia falta poner cerámica en la casa. Por que ahora no tiene piso y así los niños no podrán ensuciarse más.
El Sr. Wilber José es casado y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y este todavía esta a su cargo.
Este el primer crédito que el Sr. Wilber José a tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel me han ayudado en gran parte ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación la cual me hacia falta poner cerámica en la casa.
texts.en:
Wilber Jose has been working with the medical supply business since 2005. He has been in charge of warehouse number 3 for four years. Wilber Jose will use the money from this loan to buy cement, stones, sand and ceramic tiles in order to add tiles to his home so that his children will not get dirty. At this time he does not have a floor in his home. Wilber Jose is married and has one child to care for. This is his first loan through CEPRODEL. Jose states, "The financing I got from ceprodel has helped me very much and I've been able to improve my home, which needed tiles."

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, stones, tiles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 4 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción: ladrillo, cemento, etc. para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita y el pago de la mano de obra, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is married and has three children under his care, two of which are school-age. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for three years. During this period of time, he has invested four loans in housing improvements thanks to the funding provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent customer. This current loan will be used to invest in the purchase of construction materials like brick, cement, etc. for the remodeling of the floor of his house, as well as to pay for the labor. His objective is to provide better security and better life conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jenniffer Jeanette

texts.es:
La Señora  Jennifer Jeannette Córdoba P., Labora como Jefa de Despacho “B” en el Departamento de Química de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, ella tiene tres hijos a su cargo, los que   se encuentran en edad escolar, es 
madre Soltera, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, Zinc, ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para la edificación de un cuarto habitación, el que le Brindara mejores  condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jennifer Jeannette C. P. works as the Head of “B” office in the Chemistry Department of the National University of Engineering. She is a single mother who takes care of her 3 school-age children.. Jennifer has received loans with CEPRODEL for the last two years and thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL, she has used 3 loans to improve the home where she lives. She is an excellent client. The loan that she is asking for is to buy construction materials such as: iron, zinc, bricks, cement, etc. She will use these to build a bedroom, so that she can offer her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es Soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 4 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación del techo y el piso de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is single and has three children under his care, two of which are school-age. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for five years. During this period of time, he has invested four loans in housing improvements thanks to the funding provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent customer. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of construction materials to remodel the roof and floor of his house. His objective is to provide better security and better life conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Jeizon Franklin

texts.es:
El Señor Jeizon Franklin Sánchez Méndez, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Cinco hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Dos y medio años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 2 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y piedras, etc. El cual utilizara para la edificación de un cuarto habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor Jeizon Franklin Sánchez Méndez is a sanitation worker in the Oriental Market of Managua. He is married and has five children under the age of eighteen; three of the children are school age. He has had loans from CEPRODEL during the last two and one-half years. During this time, he has invested two loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to funds granted by CEPRODEL. He is a valued customer. This loan will be invested in construction materials such as cement, iron, stone, etc. He will use the materials to add a room to his house, with the objectives of improved security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Alfonso Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Alfonso Alberto L., tiene la edad de 48 años. El Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Cuatros hijos a su cargo, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, ladrillos, cemento, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo y el piso de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor Alfonso Alberto L. is 48 years old. He works in sanitation in the Oriental Market of Managua. He is married and has four children in school. During the last five years, thanks to loans granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested 6 loans in the improvement of his home. He is a valued customer. This loan will be invested in construction materials such as zinc, metal structural supports, bricks, cement, etc. He will use these materials to replace the roof and floor of his home, with the objectives of improved security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Edgard Antonio C. Sánchez, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Seis hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 11 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgard Antonio C. Sánchez in charge of cleaning in the Oriental Market in Managua. He cares for six children, three of whom are of school-age. He is married and has taken loans from Ceprodel for six years. During this time, he has invested eleven loans in household improvements, thanks to the financing offered by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The credit he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of construction materials including zinc, beams, etc, which he will use to remodel the roof of his home. His goal is to offer more security and a better life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
El Señor Santos Pablo R. R., tiene la edad de 36 años. El Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene seis hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Pablo R. R. is 36 years old. He is in charge of cleaning in the Oriental Market in Managua. He cares for six children, three of whom are of school-age. He is married and has taken loans from Ceprodel for five years. During this time, he has invested six loans in household improvements, thanks to the financing offered by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The credit he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of construction materials including zinc, beams, etc, which he will use to remodel the roof of his home. His goal is to offer more security and a better life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Armando De Jesús N. R., tiene la edad de 60 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de sus hijos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Armando de Jesus N. R. is 60 years old. He is the head sanitation inspector in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is single and takes care of 2 children, one of whom is school age. He has received loans with CEPRODEL for the last six years and thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL, he has used these loans to improve the home where he lives. He is an excellent client. The loan that he is requesting is for the labor and to buy construction materials such as: zinc, metal roofing, etc. He will use these to change the roof on his house so that he can offer his children more security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Jacinto Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Jacinto José Q. E., tiene la edad de 29 años, Labora Vigilante de Seguridad en el Mercado Oriental, el tiene cuatros hijos a su cargo, dos de sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 8 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jacinto José Q. E. is 29-years-old and works as a security guard at the Eastern Market. He is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. He has been receiving loans from CEPRODEL for five years, during which time he has invested eight loans in home improvements. Thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, Jacinto is an excellent client. He plans to use this loan to purchase building materials to renovate one floor of his house in order to provide better security and a higher quality of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of building materials.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Orlando José López, tiene la edad de 45 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene cuatros hijos a su cargo, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, piedra, etc. El cual utilizara para el reforzamiento de las paredes dela vivienda en que habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando José López is 45 years old. He is in charge of cleaning at the Oriental Market in Managua. He has four children, all of whom are of school age, and he is married.

He has obtained loans from CEPRODEL for 6 years. In this time, he has invested 6 loans in the improvements of his home, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

This loan that he seeks is to invest in manual labor and to purchase construction materials such as cement, stone, etc., which he will use to reinforce the walls of his home, with the objective of bringing more security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Señor Celso Acuña López, tiene la edad de 59 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Tres hijos a su cargo, y esto se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celso Acuña López is 59 years old. He is in charge of cleaning at the Oriental Market in Managua. He has three children, who are school-aged, and he is single.

He has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and in this period he has invested 5 loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to CEPRODEL's financing. He is an excellent client.

He seeks this loan to purchase construction materials which he will use to remodel the floor of his home, with the objective of bringing more security and a better quality of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde niña ha aprendido todo lo necesario para dedicarse al cultivo de los diversos productos oriundos de su zona; tales como la papa, el maíz, la oca, las habas, entre otros. En la época de siembra sus actividades son más intensas, por lo que cada miembro de su familia participa en la preparación de la tierra, y regresan juntos para descansar en casa; y continuar al día siguiente. 
Esto mantiene contenta a Florencia, ver que todos trabajan unidos y por eso planifica su futuro, mejorando en cada año sus cosechas.

Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida en su grupo y seguirá trabajando por el bienestar de todos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono e insecticida para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. Since she was a girl, she learned all about the cultivation of various crops native to her area, such as potato, corn, oca, broad beans, and others. During the planting season, she and her family work hard; everyone works in the field and returns home together to rest, day after day. Florencia is content because everyone works together; she plans to improve the harvest each year. This is the third time she is requesting a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very committed to her group and continues to work for the good of everyone. This loan will be invested in sacks of fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima tiene 50 años, es viuda y vive con el menor de sus hijos, de 8 años.
Desde hace más de 30 años se viene desempeñando en las tareas agrícolas con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores, quienes la apoyan en la siembra y la cosecha de sus productos. Máxima cultiva la papa principalmente, y de distintas variedades, para venderlas al por mayor en los mercados de la zona urbana. A su vez, también cría ovejas, a las cuales lleva a pastear a lugares lejanos que requieren horas de camino, por lo que regresa a casa cuando está anocheciendo. 
Ella menciona que continuará con estas actividades hasta donde le den sus fuerzas, pues le satisface mucho lo que hace, y es el medio con el que cubre los gastos de su familia.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ha sido invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal por ser  una persona seria y responsable. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de semillas y sacos de abono para sembrara en otras extensiones de terreno que posee.
texts.en:
Maxima is a 50 year-old widow who lives with the youngest of her children, who is 8 years old. For more than 30 years she has worked in agriculture with the help of her older children, who help her with the planting and harvesting of her products. Maxima mainly grows potatoes, of a number of distinct varieties, and sells them wholesale in the urban markets. At the same time she also raises sheep, which graze in remote locations that require hours of walking, and for this reason she returns to the house when it is getting dark. She mentions that she will continue with these activities as long as she has the strength, because she is very satisfied with what she does and it is the means through which she covers the household expenses. This is the first time that she is taking a loan with MFP; she has been invited to become a member of her communal bank since she is a person who is very serious and responsible. The money that she requests will be used to buy seeds and sacks of fertilizer in order to cultivate crops on other areas of land that she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia.
Desde hace un año tiene un taller que implementó en su vivienda, donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos de carpintería metálica. Cada día, él tiene varios clientes que le hacen pedidos, y Roberto cumple con mucha responsabilidad, aunque tenga que sacrificar horas de sueño para ello. Es por ello que sus clientes retornan en busca de sus servicios y lo recomiendan con otras personas.
Por el momento, Roberto sólo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, pero sus planes son de mejorar su taller comprando más herramientas, y posteriormente contratar a otras personas para incrementar la producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contento de acceder a este préstamo, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus trabajos en cerrajería; tales como fierros y electrodos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. For the past year, he has had a workshop that he set up in his home where he does all kinds of metalwork jobs. Every day, he attends to various customers who place orders with him. Although he has to sacrifice many hours of sleep, Roberto carries out these jobs with a great sense of responsibility. For that reason, his customers return to do business with him and recommend him to other people Presently, Roberto only has support from his wife, but he plans to improve his workshop by buying more tools and later by hiring more people to increase production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very happy to receive this loan, and he promises to be on time with his payments. He will use the money that he has asked for to buy materials for his work in locksmithing, such as tools and electrodes.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia  tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería; mientras lleva al campo a pastear a sus animales, cuida de sus tierras de cultivo para prevenir plagas y enfermedades de sus plantaciones de maíz, papa, arveja y habas. 
Cada 2 meses sale a vender sus vacas, toros y ovejas, a las cuales ha engordado para ofrecer un buen precio por ellas. La actividad ganadera le permite a Zenobia tener los ingresos necesarios para su hogar mientras espera la cosecha de sus cultivos. 
Para el futuro, desea mejorar la raza de sus animales y aumentar la producción de sus productos.

Esta es la 9na oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una cliente que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuentas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más animales, como ovejas y un burro, además de sacos de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home. For the past 25 years, she has devoted her time to agriculture and raising cattle. She takes her animals to the fields to graze and takes care of her farmland in order to prevent plagues and diseases in her corn, potato, pea, and bean crops. Every 2 months she goes to sell her cows, bulls, and sheep, which she has fattened up in order to offer a good price for them. Livestock raising allows Zenobia to earn the necessary income for her home while she waits to harvest her crops. In the future, she hopes to improve the breed of her animals and increase produce production. This is the 9th opportunity for a loan that she has had with MFP. She is a client who has always demonstrated responsibility with her accounts. She would use the money that she is asking for now to buy more animals such as sheep and a donkey, in addition to bags of fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20206030040) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 1 (Yên Hậu nhóm 03).


H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206030041) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206030042) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Vũ Thị Huệ (20206030043) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


4.  Đàm Thị

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L.  Nguyễn Thị is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  

L.  is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Nhinh 1 (An Ninh nhóm 07).

L.  is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L.  owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. L.  has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3, 000, 000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2008, L.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L.  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704, 000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,048,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be the third loan L. has taken out from SEDA.  L.  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Dương Thị N. is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị N. L. is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her handicraft business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 27 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

4.  Đào Thị T. is a 25 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L.  Nguyễn Thị (20213010029) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Nhinh 1 (An Ninh nhóm 07).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L.  kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Dương Thị N. (20213010030) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị N. L. (20213010031) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010033) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Đào Thị T. (20213010008) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga N. Thị is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nga is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm xá 1.


Nga is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nga owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Nga has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3.100.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Nga joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 4th loan Nga has taken out with SEDA.  Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đặng Thị T.  is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Nghiêm Thị M. is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Huê is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


4.  Trần Thị C. is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Nghiêm Thị D. is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


6.  Nghiêm Thị H. is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
