loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trác Bút 1 - nhóm 01.


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She is now requesting a new  loan of 4.256.000 VND which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out with SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 39 años, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposo (Jhonny), de 40 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Bryan de 14, Jimena de 6 y Florentino de apenas 10 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en su acogedora casa que es propia, ubicada en la sierra del Perú.

Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa que dedica casi todo el día a atender su negocio en un local alquilado. Hace 19 años decidió implementar un salón de belleza donde pone a prueba toda su habilidad con las manos y donde también da forma a los cabellos de múltiples clientes que la buscan, pues no hay un negocio igual por la zona, por esa razón tiene muy buenas ganancias.
A Blanca le agrada mucho atender en su salón, ya que se entretiene y le alcanza el tiempo para atender a sus hijos. 
Asimismo, hace algunos meses se le ocurrió comprar algunos adornos para venderlos en su mismo local, en una pequeña vitrina; así empezó su pequeño bazar, el cual con el tiempo también ha crecido.
Ella se da abasto sola para sus dos negocios, porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy segura que será puntual y responsable en cada uno de los pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal con sus compañeras del banco comunal que es muy organizado. Blanca tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en equipar su salón de belleza para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y también comprará mercadería para su negocio de venta de adornos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old. She lives peacefully at home with her husband Jhonny, who is 40 years old, and their three children: Bryan (age 14), Jimena (age 6), and Florentino (age 10 months). They live in a cramped house that they own in the mountains of Peru.

She is a very hardworking woman who spends most of her day attending to her business from a rented location. Nineteen years ago, Blanca decided to start a beauty salon where she honed her manual skills for styling the hair of clients who seek her services. There are no other similar businesses like hers in the area, so she is able to generate very good revenues.

Blanca enjoys working at her salon, but she also manages to have time to look after her children. A few months ago, she bought a few decorations to sell from her salon. She keeps these items in a small display case, which was the start of a small bazaar. Over time, this part of her business has grown as well. She is able to cope with having two businesses because it allows her to stay ahead and provide the best for her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Blanca is very confident that she will be responsible in making each of her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members. Her Communal Bank is a very organized group. Blanca will use the loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon to make her customers feel more comfortable. In addition, she will buy merchandise for her decoration sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her beauty salon & decorations to sell

loans.name: Brisayda

texts.es:
Brisayda, es el nombre de esta trabajadora y dedicada mujer, que a sus 29 años vive con su esposo (Dante), de también 29 años, y con su hijo Johan de 4 años. Juntos, y muy felices por lo que hasta ahora han logrado, viven en su casa que es propia en un pueblo tranquilo de la sierra del Perú.

Cada día es un esfuerzo constante para salir adelante, ella debe trabajar de lunes a domingo, desde muy temprano hasta llegada la noche, y fuerzas no le faltan, ya que es muy activa. Su negocio es la venta de productos comestibles en la tienda que tiene desde hace 4 años en su vivienda, allí vende la más variada cantidad de productos que sus asiduos clientes buscan, a quienes atiende amablemente, porque este negocio le brinda buenas ganancias.
Brisayda sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa y es por eso que trabaja a diario, casi sin descanso; atiende a sus pequeños desde muy temprano, los alista para el colegio y empieza su labor. A veces la vida nos demuestra cuánto es capaz de esforzarse una madre por el bienestar de sus hijos, no hay cansancio, no hay nada que lo impida y así es Briseyda una mujer incansable.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser responsable, además no quiere dejar mal a su banco comunal, ya que está integrado por otras mujeres muy empeñosas. Brisayda tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en surtir su tienda de comestibles con más mercadería para cubrir las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes que le compran a diario.
texts.en:
This hardworking, dedicated woman is called Brisayda. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband Dante, who is also 29 years old, and her four-year-old son Johan. Living together in their own house in a quiet village in the mountains of Peru, they are very proud of all they have accomplished so far. Every day is a constant struggle to make progress. Brisayda has to work seven days a week, from early morning until nightfall, but she finds the strength for this as she is very energetic. She runs a business selling groceries in the shop she has owned for four years in her own home. There she sells the wide variety of products that are sought after by her regular customers, who she serves in a friendly manner, as this business generates a good income. Brisayda knows that her efforts are rewarded and so she works day after day, with almost no time to rest. She gets up very early to look after her little ones, get them ready for school and then start work. Sometimes life shows us just how much a mother is capable of doing for the wellbeing of her children. Without tiring, nothing stops Brisayda - she is indefatigable. This is the seventh loan Brisayda has had from Kiva Field Partner, Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). There is no doubt about her responsibility, and furthermore she does not want to let down her community bank, which includes other enterprising women. Brisayda is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in stocking up her grocery store with more merchandise to cover the needs of her neighbors and customers who buy from her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo (Wilfredo), de 37 años, y con sus dos pequeños hijos: Antonio de 14 y Francis de 13 años. Todos viven juntos en su cálido bogar, su casa propia, ubicada en un pueblo muy tranquilo de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 2 años se levanta de madrugada para atender a sus hijos y después empezar a trabajar lavando ropa en un hotel muy conocido de la ciudad. Asimismo, Lucy brinda el servicio de limpieza de casas, y que es conocida por hacer un buen trabajo.
A ella le gusta mucho su labor, aunque es cansada, pero le genera buenas ganancias y esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Lucy trabaja desde muy joven, por eso no se le hace difícil esforzarse en su trabajo.
Y como si fuera poco, algunas veces le ayuda a su madre en su puesto de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de su localidad, por lo que  tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar este  negocio, ya que quiere seguir ayudando y sacar adelante no sólo a su propia familia, sino también a su madre que es tan trabajadora como ella.

Este es el tercer préstamo e Lucy con MFP y está dispuesta a ser puntual en cada uno de los pagos, ya que quiere que su banco comunal siga trabajando por el progreso de todos. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el negocio de su madre, comprará mercadería para abastecer el puesto de comida de su madre.
texts.en:
Lucy is 33 and lives with her husband Wilfredo, who is 37, and their two small children: Antonio, 14, and Francis, 13. All of them live in their warm home, which is their own. It is located in a very peaceful town in the mountains in Peru.

For 2 years, she has gotten up very early to attend to her children and later has started working doing laundry in a very well-known hotel in the city. Lucy also offers a house-cleaning service, and she is known for doing a good job. She likes her job a lot, even though it is tiring. It generates good income for her, and this lets her help her husband with their home's expense. Lucy has worked since she was very young, and it's not difficult for her to work hard at her job.

As if that weren't enough, she helps her mother sometimes at a stand selling food at one of the markets in the area. What she has planned for the future is to expand this business since she wants she wants to continue helping and taking care of not only her own family, but also her mother, who is just as hard-working as she is.

This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is willing to be punctual with each one of her payments, since she wants her communal bank to keep workng towards the progress of all of the members. She will invest the money she is requesting in her mother's business and will buy merchandise to supply her food stand. .

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her mother's business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es una mujer muy alegre, tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja de toda la vida (Roberto), de 39 años, y con sus 3 inquietos hijos: Frank de 10, Jean Pierre de 7 y Derlys de 2 años. Desde hace varios años viven en su casa propia ubicada bajo el cielo azul de la sierra peruana.

Desde muy joven ella veía cómo sus padres trabajaban cultivando las tierras que les brindaban el sustento diario; es así que aprendió todas las técnicas y todo lo necesario sobre la agricultura, lo cual aplicó cuando empezó a trabajar para su propia familia al lado de su esposo.
A diario debe levantarse al amanecer y salir al campo para brindarle el cuidado necesario a sus cultivos de papa y zanahoria; así como también cuida de su ganado vacuno. A Faustina le gusta mucho el trabajo en el campo porque es lo que aprendió desde muy pequeña, además la venta de sus productos, especialmente la papa, le generan buenas ganancias.
Faustina afirma, muy orgullosa, que no dejará de trabajar hasta que sus hijos tengan una profesión, pues quiere que estudien solo así podrán salir adelante solos cuando ella les falte.
Para el futuro, quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad, ya que sabe que este negocio genera buenas ganancias económicas.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que Faustina tiene con MFP y está segura que será responsable y puntual en cada pago, pues sabe que sólo las personas que cumplen con sus responsabilidades salen adelante. A su vez, está contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está integrado por mujeres muy luchadoras con ganas de salir adelante. Faustina ya tiene pensado el destino del dinero que solicita, y será invertido en la empezar el abastecimiento de su ansiada tienda de comestibles, lo que con mucho esfuerzo logrará realizar en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Faustina (34) is a very cheerful woman. She lives with her life partner, Roberto (39), and their 3 lively children: Frank (10), Jean Pierre (7) and Derlys (2). They have had their own house under the blue skies of the Peruvian mountains for some years now. From an early age, she watched her parents farming their land to put food on the table; that is how she learned the techniques and everything she needs to know in order to farm, and she has been applying that knowledge since she began working on her own farm alongside her husband. She gets up at dawn every day to go out to the fields, where she grows potatoes and carrots; she also keeps cattle. Faustina likes farming a lot; it's what she learned when she was a little girl, and she also makes a good profit from selling her produce, particularly potatoes. Faustina proudly says that she will work unceasingly until her children have a profession, since she wants them to study and be able to fend for themselves when she is no longer with them. Looking to the future, she wants to set up a grocery store in the center of the city, since she knows that is a profitable business. This is Faustina's seventh loan from MFP and she is certain to be responsible and punctual with the repayments since she knows that only people who fulfill their responsibilities get ahead in life. She is also happy working with the community bank as the members are hard-working women who want to succeed. Faustina plans to invest the loan in stock for the grocery store she plans to open in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo (Crisanto), de 42 años; juntos tienen 3 pequeños hijos: Leonela de 11, Luz de 8 y Jefferson de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en una tranquila zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde muy pequeña Maria aprendió que solo se puede salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Ella era una comerciante que viajaba frecuentemente para vender su mercadería, pero al darse cuenta que sus niños empezaron a bajar sus calificaciones, esto la mortificó mucho, por lo que decide implementar un negocio en su propia vivienda, y no tuvo mejor idea que empezar el negocio de venta de comida, ya que su sala era amplia y casi perfecta para el  proyecto. Actualmente, también vende algunos productos comestibles, como una bodega y en un solo local tiene dos negocios muy rentables, pues en la zona no hay competencia.
Así trabaja Maria desde hace más de un año, casi sin descanso, le va muy bien y es por eso que está muy satisfecha con su negocio. Y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana vende desayunos, para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la suple en la atención cuando ella debe salir.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy satisfecha con el apoyo brindado, por lo que promete ser responsable con cada uno de sus pagos. Además manifiesta que el trabajo de su banco comunal es muy importante para el éxito y progreso de todos. Maria tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en un nuevo negocio junto a su esposo, que sería una llantería (venta y cambio de llantas), ya que para cumplir sus metas no existe fatiga ni impedimento.
texts.en:
Maria (35) is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Crisanto (42), and their three small children: Leonela (11), Luz (8) and Jefferson (5). They live in their own house in a quiet area of the Peruvian mountains. From an early age, Maria learned that success comes only through hard work and dedication. She worked as a traveling sales representative; however, she was mortified to discover that her children's grades were beginning to fall, so she decided to set up a business in her own house. She opened a small restaurant in her own living room, which is spacious and ideal for this purpose. She also sells groceries, so on the same premises she has two very profitable businesses, since there is no competition in the area. Maria has had this business for over a year; things are going well and she is very satisfied with the results. Moreover, on weekends she serves breakfasts with the help of her husband, who takes over the business when she has to go out. This is her seventh loan from MFP and she is very happy with the support she has received; she promises to repay punctually. Maria also considers that the community bank is very important for everyone to succeed and improve their situation. She plans to invest the money in a new business with her husband: a tire store, where they will sell and change tires. They are determined to work hard to achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años, vive con sus tres hijos pequeños: Gian Marco de 13, Jordan de 8 y Luis de 4 años, y con su madre.
Desde muy pequeña le gustaba ayudar a su madre a prepara pan de forma artesanal, se acostumbró tanto que llegó a aprender muy bien la técnica necesaria. Ya adulta, luego de la separación de su esposo, empezó a trabajar para una panadería, donde también fue contratada su madre. A diario, María mezcla los ingredientes para obtener los más deliciosos bocadillos, capaces de convencer con su exquisito sabor al más reacio de los comensales. A ella le gusta su trabajo, es por eso que lo desempeña con muchas ganas y le es muy rentable, pues le alcanza para cuidar a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación, pues desea que ellos logren lo que ella no pudo, una profesión.
Para el futuro, María piensa tener su propio negocio al lado de su madre y convertirlo en la mejor panadería de la zona, ya que tiene grandes aspiraciones y sobretodo, ganas de salir adelante.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está convencida que será puntual, como lo es siempre, para no quedar mal con los miembros de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará insumos y utensilios para empezar la implementación de su propia panadería y así progresar en el  futuro.
texts.en:
Maria (28) lives with her mother and with her three young children, Gian Marco (13), Jordan (8) and Luis (4). From an early age she helped her mother bake bread at home and became a skilled baker. After separating from her husband, she began to work at a bakery where her mother worked. She mixes the ingredients to make delicious baked goods that are a real temptation. She likes her work; she is a willing worker and earns a good wage, which enables her to maintain her children and pay for their education since she wants them to have what she couldn't have: a profession. Looking to the future, Maria plans to open a bakery with her mother, and make it the best bakery in the area; she has great aspirations and a strong desire to succeed. This is her sixth loan from MFP, and she will repay it punctually, as she has in the past, so as not to let down the members of the community bank. She will use the money to buy ingredients and utensils to start setting up her own bakery and improve her situation.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her own bakery

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es:
Melinda es una simpática mujer de 31 años, vive muy feliz en compañía de su esposo (Egiberto), que tiene 41 años. Esta pareja tiene 5 hermosos y traviesos niños: Andrea de 13, Luz de 11, James de 9, Michael de 6 y Junely de 4 años; pero además ella se encuentra esperando a su sexto hijo y ya tiene 6 meses de embarazo.

Ya que su familia es numerosa, su esposo además de trabajar en sus chacras, la ayuda con las labores domésticas, ya que juntos quieren salir adelante para que sus hijos tengan lo mejor.
Por otro lado, Melinda se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace 4 años, ella empezó con esta actividad por casualidad, ya que un día una de sus vecinas (quien se dedicaba a este negocio) tuvo que viajar repentinamente; y le vendió la leña restante para que la usara en su casa; pero unos días después algunos clientes de su vecina vinieron a comprar leña y al no encontrar a la antigua vendedora ella se ofreció a venderles lo que tenía en su casa; es así que empezó con este rentable negocio. Aunque ella trabaja sola porque su esposo sale a trabajar muy temprano, tiene la ayuda de sus hijos mayores que por sí solos quieren ayudarle.
Como Melinda es una mujer muy emprendedora ya tiene pensado ampliar el negocio en un futuro no muy lejano y contratar a una persona para que la ayude.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar puntualmente, como siempre, cada una de sus cuotas, pues desea salir adelante y sabe que para lograrlo debe ser responsable. Por otro lado, está satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son muy organizados y trabajadores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más leña para ampliar su negocio, ya que tiene gran demanda.
texts.en:
Melinda is a very kind 31 year old woman, who lives very happily with her husband (Egiberto), who is 41 years old. This couple has five beautiful and mischievous children: Andrea (13), Luz (11), James (9), Michael (6), and Junely (4), and they are also expecting their sixth child and Melinda is already six months pregnant. Since their family is large, her husband not only works in his fields, but he also helps with the housework, since they both want to advance so their children have a better life.

On the other hand, Melinda has worked for four years selling firewood. She began this activity by chance, as one day one of her neighbors (who works in this industry) had to travel suddenly and sold her remaining wood to Melinda so that she could use it in her home. But a few days later some of the neighbors customers came to buy firewood and upon finding the saleswoman absent, Melinda offered to sell them the wood she had in the house. In this way she began with this profitable business. Although she works alone because her husband leaves very early in the morning, she has the help of her eldest children who want to help her. Since Melinda is an industrious woman, she has thought about growing her business and hiring another person to help her.

This is the seventh loan that she's had with MFP and she is ready to pay on time, as always, every one of her repayments, since she wants to advance and knows that to do so she must be responsible. On the other hand, she is satisfied with the work of her community bank because her friends are very organized and hard working. With the money she seeks she will buy more firewood to expand her business as she has had great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Frevisminda

texts.en:
Frevisminda O. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old. Frevisminda is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, Frevisminda sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $56 a month from this activity. In 2009, Frevisminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for a business of pig-fattening.

Frevisminda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her current business of selling daily use products. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Romulo C. S

texts.en:
Romulo C. S M. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 50 years old. Romulo C. S is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Romulo C. S plants, harvests and sells rice. Romulo C. S has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately $67 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Romulo C. S joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Romulo C. S has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Romulo C. S is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 5th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Veronica is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in retail sector operating a specialized retail store.While not the only means for generating revenue the means source of income comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine B. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Cristine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristine sells fish in the local community. Cristine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $22 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Cristine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Cristine is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her small business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the education of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her small business

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee G. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Haidee owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Haidee has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $62 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Haidee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Haidee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to add to her products for sale. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to add to her products for sale.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma sells fresh food such as bread in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $54 a month from this activity. Part of her loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Yusri

texts.en:
Yusri is 26 years old and married with no children. He sells tennis shoes.Yusri uses the profits from his sales to support his elderly parents, who he takes care of and is responsible for. 

Yusri's business is growing very well, that's why he is applying for a loan of $2000. He wants to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Gaza city of Palestine. He is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Ahmad owns and operates a barber shop. The primary source of this business's income comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2000 USD which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. Ahmad plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is the owner of a grocery store in Gaza city, Palestine. Maher is 33 years old, married, and the father of five children. To grow his business, he would like to put money into his store. The profits derived from his business will enable him to better meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies of groceries for resale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa J., who trades in cutlery and enamel dishes, owns a shop in the central business area.  She is married to a businessman and has three children, all in primary school.  Hawa is requesting a loan to buy additional cutlery and enamel dishes from Freetown and Conakry to increase her stock, sales and profit, and hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to expand her business and educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en:
Kaday J. is a business woman who trades in provisions accessories. She owns a shop located at Torkpoi Town. She is married to a pastor and has three children; the eldest is in high school, the second is in infant school, and the third is a baby. She is among our best clients, and she has a very good credit history who graduated to individual loan.

She needs a loan to purchase additional provisions. She intends to use the proceeds of the loan to take care of her children up to university.

loans.use: To Purchase Provisions

loans.name: Jestina S.s

texts.en:
Jestina S.S. M. is the secretary of a government-affiliated organization and also owns a retail shop at King Street Fagoya. She lives with her two children in a house which she shares with two dependents who assist her at her shop. 

Jestina is seeking a loan to buy more home products to meet the needs of her customers. She intend to use proceeds from the loan to pay for her children's schooling up until university.

loans.use: To buy home products

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. is married with three children and two dependents. Before owning her own shop, Veronica used to sell her items door to door. Now, she spends most of her day at her store. 

Veronica is seeking a loan to buy more food items for her store and increase her capital base. She would like to use profits from her store for her household and children's education.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Posseh K. is married and has four children, all in high school. She also has two relatives staying with her. Her store is located in the Dove Cut market area . For the past thirty years, Posseh has been in business and has been doing well. She is very hardworking, as she stays in her store from 8 a.m. - 9 p.m. on a daily basis.
In order to respond to her children's schooling needs and other domestic issues, Posseh is seeking a loan in order to buy more stock.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Sidratu D

texts.en:
Sidratu B. is a merchant who is married to a teacher. She has three children, one in university, one in senior secondary school and the other just finished high school. She has two dependents staying with her.
For about five years now, Sidratu has been in business.  She is now seeking a loan in order to buy more stock for her business and thereafter use the proceeds to provide for her children's schooling needs. Her business is located in a strategic location in the center part of town.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions

loans.name: Christiana A

texts.en:
Christiana A K. is married to a trade unionist. She has three children, all of whom are in high school. Two of her relatives live with her.

Over the past fifteen years, Christiana's business has grown from a small venture to that of a shop where she stocks her goods.
Christiana wants to use this loan to buy more stock to increase her capital and to provide for her children's schooling needs.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Ispandiyar

texts.en:
Ispandiyar Q. is a responsible father of five children. From the time he was a young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Ispandiyar hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve working conditions.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali H. is 47. He is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture.

Ali is the father of five children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ali applied for a loan for the purchase of animals to breed.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en: Elgun M. is 25 years old. He breeds and raises sheep. When Elgun recognized the need to invest in his business, he decided to construct a better shelter for his his animals. He is requesting a loan to buy the construction supplies for this project. He believes that his loan request will be granted and that he will be able to begin his work. With the loan, Elgun will purchase fifteen lambs and construction supplies to improve his sheep barn.

loans.use: To purchase 15 lambs and repair his sheep-shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie G. is from the village of Barangay Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ronnie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest. In 2009, Ronnie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita B. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Merlita owns and operates a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza L. is from the village of Capellan. She is 41 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Flordeliza owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta T. is from the village of Capellan,Ilagan,Isabela. She is 52 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children.

Aniceta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Aniceta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.

Aniceta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 26 años, vive con su esposa (Haydee), de 30 años, y con sus dos pequeños hijos; Jefferson de 5 y Renzo de solo un mes de nacido. Juntos, muy contentos y con ganas de salir adelante viven en una acogedora casa que es propia y está ubicada en una apacible zona en la sierra del Perú. 

Desde que era muy pequeño Alberto recuerda cómo sus padres sembraban la tierra en la que él  jugaba inocentemente; desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario que debía saber un hombre de campo. Hoy se dedica a la agricultura y cada día se levanta muy temprano a cuidar sus cultivos de papa y olluco, con cuya venta logra mantener los gastos de su familia.
En la actualidad siembra y también le da mantenimiento a sus tierras, solo y sin ayuda, él considera la labor agrícola muy rentable, ya que la cosecha rinde bastante y además puede poner en práctica los conocimientos que aprendió desde pequeño.
Lo que más desea Alberto es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y a su esposa, quien también lo ayuda en sus momentos libres.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual y responsable en cada uno de sus pagos porque no le gusta quedar mal, ni le gustaría dejar mal a los miembros de su banco comunal, quienes se esfuerzan por mejorar cada día. Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas para el cuidado y tratamiento de sus tierras para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Alberto is 26. He lives with his 30 year old wife, Haydee, and their two children. Jefferson is five, and Renzo is only one month old. They are very happy together, and they have the desire to get ahead. They live in a cozy house, which is their own. It is located in a peaceful area in the mountain ranges of Perú. Alberto remembers since he was very small how his parents planted on the land where he innocently played. From then on, he learned everything a man of the fields should know. He now devotes himself to agriculture. He gets up very early everyday to take care of his potato and “olluco” (Peruvian tuber) crops. With their sale he is able to pay the family’s expenses. He currently plants and also maintains his fields alone and without help. He considers agricultural work to be very profitable. The harvest produces plenty, and he can also put into practice the knowledge he learned since he was small. What Alberto wants most is to give his children and his wife the best. His wife also helps him in her free time. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual and responsible in each of his payments. He does not like to create problems for the other members of his Communal Bank. They work to improve everyday. He will use the money he is asking for to buy compost, fertilizers, and insecticides for the care and treatment of his land in order to get a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey G. is from the village of Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jeffrey owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky I. is from the town of Ilagan. She is 26 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Pinky owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables and cooked foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Pinky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo (Rómulo), de también 51 años. Ellos viven en la tranquilidad de su hogar con 3 de sus 8 hijos; Edwin de 20, Nilda de 18 y Freddy de 15 años, el resto de sus hijos son mayores y ya tienen familias propias.

Cada día en la vida de esta trabajadora mujer es una lucha constante por salir adelante, se levanta muy temprano con muchas ganas de empezar a trabajar en su negocio de venta de carne, en un puesto de uno de los mercados mayoristas de la ciudad. A Ambrosia le gusta atender muy amablemente a sus clientes, lo hace con mucha paciencia y dedicación, y laborando todo el día logra obtener buenas ganancias, las cuales le permiten ayudar a su familia.
En ocasiones, su esposo la ayuda con su negocio, sobre todo cuando ella tiene que salir. Para el futuro desea ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con una vitrina donde pueda exhibir las carnes frescas que vende. Ambrosia tiene muchos proyectos en mente y sabe que todos los puede hacerlos realidad con esfuerzo.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que es muy responsable y honesta, además no le gustaría quedar mal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, además quiere modernizarlo con nuevos utensilios para llamar más la atención de los clientes y vender en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is 51. She lives with her husband, Rómulo, who is also 51. They live in the tranquility of their home with three of their eight children. Edwin is 20, Nilda is 18, and Freddy is 15. The rest of the children are grown and have their own families. Every day of her life is a constant fight to get ahead for this hard-working woman. She gets up very early with a great desire to start working in her business of selling meat. She works at a stall in one of the wholesale markets in the city. She likes to wait on her customers very kindly. She does it with much patience and dedication. By working all day she gets good earnings, which allow her to help her family. Sometimes her husband helps with her business, mostly when she has to leave. In the future she wants to expand her business and equip it with a showcase where she would be able to display the fresh meat that she sells. Ambrosia has many projects in mind, and she knows that with effort she can make all of them a reality. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time because she is very responsible and honest. Also, she would not like to have problems. She will use the money she is asking for to buy merchandise to stock her business. She also wants to modernize the business with new utensils. This will get more customer attention, and she will sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em L., 34, is married and lives with her two children and husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife.

Her husband is a businessman who buys and sells used motorbikes. He has been involved in this business to earn his living and to support his family since 2006 and is able to earn an income of US$5 per day.

L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for re-sale to make a profit. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband to re-sell

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es:
Artemia es una simpática mujer D. 57 años, ella comparte sus días con el amor D. toda su vida (Lucio), D. 62 años; con él tiene 8 hijos, pero sólo viven con 3 D. ellos: Nilton D. 30, Adrián D. 18 y Ricardo D. 14.

A pesar D. su edad y su delicada apariencia ella es una mujer muy luchadora, y aun se esfuerza por trabajar porque según menciona: “en esta zona del país los ociosos no sobreviven”. DesD. muy joven se dedica a la siembra D. papa y olluco, este oficio lo aprendió D. sus padres y se ha dedicado a la labor agrícola durante toda su vida, así ha ayudado a su esposo, que también se dedica a la siembra, a sacar adelante a sus hijos porque esa es la mayor preocupación que tienen ambos. El día D. Artemia empieza a las 5 D. la mañana cuando se levanta para atender a su familia y una hora mas tarD. se dirige a la chacra donD. no solo vigila sus cultivos al lado D. su esposo, sino también debe cuidar a sus animales, ya que tiene ganado ovino.
A Artemia le gusta realizar ambas actividades porque son tranquilas y rentables, aunque en años anteriores tuvo que experimentar la pérdida D. parte D. su cosecha, los años y la experiencia le han brindado las herramientas necesarias para aprender todas las técnicas para producir en cantidad con calidad.

Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha con lo alcanzado hasta hoy, es por eso que se compromete a ser, una vez más, cumplida en cada uno D. los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas que le ayudarán a mejorar y preparar sus tierras para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Artemia is a likeable 57 year old woman. She shares her days with the love of her life, 62 year old Lucio. They have eight children, but only three of the children live with them. Nilton is 30, Adrián is 18, and Ricardo is 14. In spite of her age and her delicate appearance, this woman is a fighter. She still puts forth a lot of effort working because she says, “This is the part of the country where the idle do not survive”. She has been planting potatoes and “olluco” (Peruvian tuber) since she was very young. She learned from her parents, and she has worked in agriculture her whole life. That is how she has helped her husband, who also farms. They do it to get their children ahead because this is the biggest worry they both have. Artemia’s day starts at five in the morning when she gets up to take care of her family. One hour later she goes to the farm where she not only watches over the crops at her husband’s siD., but she also takes care of their animals. They have sheep. Artemia likes doing both activities because they are peaceful and profitable. Even though she lost part of her harvest in previous years, the years and the experience have given her the necessary tools to learn the techniques to produce quantity and quality. This is the sixth time she has had a loan with MFP. She is very satisfied with what she has achieved so far. That is why she promises, one more time, to make each one of her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy compost, fertilizers, and insecticides, which will help her improve and prepare her land for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline R. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Evangeline operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo (Wilder), de 32 años, y con sus dos inquietos hijos: Wilder de 8 y Abel de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en una acogedora casa, que es propia, ubicada en un tranquilo pueblo de la sierra del Perú.

Todas las mañanas Mery empieza su jornada desde la madrugada, ya que tiene muchas labores  por realizar durante el día; empieza atendiendo a sus pequeños para que asistan a la escuela a tiempo; luego debe cocinar para que cuando sus hijos regresen se alimenten bien, y después se dirige hacia sus tierras donde siembra papa. Toda esta labor la hace sola, pues su esposo se dedica al pastoreo durante todo el día; aunque la labor que cumple ella es muy cansada, la realiza sin ningún problema porque siempre piensa en el  futuro de sus hijos y que no les falte nada, ya que quiere que estudien y lleguen a tener una profesión.
Ella sabe que todo lo que se propone se puede lograr, es por eso que trabaja sin descanso en el cultivo de sus tierras y siempre obtiene una cosecha segura, la cual vende a sus clientes mayoristas del mercado de su localidad.

Esta es la sexta vez que Mery tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser responsable como siempre lo ha sido, además de puntual, ya que sabe que solo así logrará todo lo que se ha propuesto en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar sacos de abono y fertilizantes para cuidar bien sus tierras ante cualquier problema que se pueda presentar.
texts.en:
Mery is 27 years old and lives with her husband, Wilder, who is 32. They have two lively sons: Wilder, who is 8, and Abel, who is 4. They all live in a cozy house, which they own, located in a quiet town in the Peruvian mountains. Every morning Mery begins her day at dawn, because she has many jobs to do during the day. She begins by taking care of her little ones, so that they can get to school on time. Later she needs to cook so that when her sons come home they will have good food to eat. After that she heads to her fields, where she grows potatoes. She does all this alone, as her husband works as a shepherd all day long. Although the work she does is very tiring, she does it with no problems because she is always thinking of her children’s future and doesn’t want them to lack for anything. She wants them to study and eventually pursue their own careers. She knows that she can achieve whatever she puts her mind to, and for this reason she works tirelessly in the cultivation of her lands. She always obtains a good harvest, which she sells to her wholesale customers in the town. This is the sixth time that Mery has gotten a loan with MFP. She is sure that she will be as responsible as always, and on time with payments, because she knows that this is the only way to achieve what she has planned in life, With the money she is asking for, she plans to buy bags of manure and fertilizers in order to take good care of her lands in case any problems might arise.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo (Eleazar), de 44 años; tienen una numerosa familia con 8 hijos, de los cuales sólo 7 viven con ellos; Luz de 18, Juan de 16, Cristian de 14, Medalith de 12, Lizbeth de 10, Karen de 6 y Shirley de 4 años.

Su negocio es la venta de las verduras que cultiva su esposo en sus chacras; como habas, zanahoria, espinaca y alverja, pero para incrementar su mercadería también compra de otros agricultores. Adicionalmente, Nery vende comida en su vivienda, pues le gusta mantenerse ocupada y emprende cualquier tipo de negocio que le rinda buenas ganancias.
Sus ganancias son muy buenas y ella se animó a incursionar en el comercio porque su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente para lograr mantener a sus hijos. Por tal motivo, Nery desea crecer en su negocio y no sólo vender verduras, sino también otros productos que demanden sus clientes.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere tener ningún tipo de problemas, además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que es íntegro. Con el dinero que solicita comprará juguetes para venderlos en su pueblo y así aprovechar las fiestas navideñas; también adquirirá comestibles para la elaboración de las comidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Nery is 40 years old, she lives with her husband (Eleazar), who is 44. They have a large family with 8 children, only 7 live with them - Luz 18, Juan 16, Cristian 14, Medalith 12, Lizbeth 10, Karen 6 and Shirley 4. She sells vegetables that her husband grows on their small farm; like broad beans, carrots, spinach and peas, but to increase their stock she also buys from other farmers. In addition to this, Nery sells food at her home, as she likes to keep busy and undertakes whatever kind of business that brings her good profits. Her profits are very good and she got into business because her husband wasn't earning enough to support their children. For that reason, Nery wants to grow her business and sell not only vegetables, but also other products that her customers want. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is committed to paying all her installments on time, since she doesn't want to have any problems In addition she is very satisfied with the work of her communal bank of which she is a member. With the money she is requesting she will buy toys to sell in her village and so take advantage of the Christmas season. She will also purchase foodstuffs for making the food that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment for sale of toys for Christmas

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Brak P., 47, is a widow who cares for her school-aged child in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she selling traditional Cambodian medicine and earns $7 per day. 

Brak and her family seek to improve their standard of living by generating a better income.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase more medicines to resell. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to run a big store selling more traditional medicines. She also wants her child to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy medicine to re-sale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es una mujer de 49 años, vive con su esposo (Víctor), de 51 años, y con 4 de sus 6 hijos: Josué de 19, Juana de 17, Eloy de 14 y Emerson de 12 años. Sus hijos mayores estudian en la capital en busca de un futuro mejor.

Ella se dedica a la laboriosa actividad de la agricultura, siembra papa de muy buena calidad, además de olluco con la ayuda de su esposo. Juntos siembran, vigilan las tierras, les dan el tratamiento adecuado y luego ven la recompensa en su cosecha que siempre es muy productiva, lo que les permite vender todo y obtener dinero para mantener a sus hijos.
Pero Teofila no solo se dedica a la siembra, sino también cría carneros y vende la carne de éstos a muy buen precio, este negocio la tiene muy entusiasmada y lo quiere ampliar para convertirse en una gran comerciante de carne de carnero.
Como una mujer emprendedora no tiene miedo a empezar nuevos negocios y está dispuesta a seguir soñando, trazarse metas que sabe algún día se harán realidad con esfuerzo constante.

Es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal ni con la financiera, ni con sus compañeros integrantes de su banco comunal, que al igual que ella son personas muy trabajadoras. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de más semilla de papa para aumentar su producción; también adquirirá más carneros para seguir creciendo en la venta de la carne que hasta hoy le ha dado buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Teofila is 49 years old and lives with her husband Victor, who is 51, and four of their six children: Josué (age 19), Juana (age 17), Eloy (age 14), and Emerson (age 12). The older children are studying in the capital so that they can pursue a better future.

Teofila works hard at farming, growing high quality crops of potatoes and ulluco with the help of her husband. Working together, they keep watch over their land, provide it with proper treatment, and reap the reward of a very productive harvest. Selling their entire harvest allows them to earn income to support their children.

In addition to farming, Teofila also raises sheep and sells the meat at a good price. She is very excited about this business and wants to expand it to the point of becoming a well-known vendor of mutton. As a female entrepreneur, Teofila is not afraid of starting new businesses and always continue to dream. She establishes goals for herself because she knows that she can reach them someday with consistent effort.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Teofila is careful to be responsible and punctual with her payments because she does not want to create problems with her finances or with the other members of her Communal Bank, who are hardworking people like her. She will use the money to buy more potato seedling to increase her production. In addition, she will acquire more sheep to increase her mutton sales which have been successful so far.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seedlings & sheep

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:

Aida has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 1,500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) in two years. She says that she would like to keep the pace at which her business is expanding and would like to add more variety of clothes for her customers. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

M. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.  She thinks this loan will reduce public transportation expenses.  This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  She hopes to improve her business.  She wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas C., 37, is from the village of San Manuel. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a service-based business, primarily hairdressing and beauty services to local community residents.  Felicitas has been in business for over 11 years.

Felicitas joined ASKI to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI.  Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP  to purchase needed materials to provide customer services.  Felicitas plans to use additional revenue to support her family. 
--------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 42, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is a farmer in her village.  Sourn has worked on her farm land since 1998 and earns an income of $3 per day.  Her husband is a driver for a private company. 

Sourn and her family want to improve their standard of living.  She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase cow dung from local farmers in her village for re-sale. It is useful for producing natural fertilizer. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a truck to transport cow dung to sell in the province.  Sourn also wants to build a nice new house for her family.

loans.use: Buy cow dung for re-sale.

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Mrs. L., 54, is a widow with three children, and they live together in a wooden house located in the village of Banteay Meanchey, the province of Cambodia. Two of her kids are employed: her first child is a repairman in the stone crushing industry and her second child is staff for an electrical sale shop in nearby country, while the remaining one attends school. To earn a living, L. sells grocery inventory in the busy market and earns an average of $4 each day to pay for family’s daily foods. Because now L.’s school-aged child attains university and needs money to pay a school fee. L. lacks money to have paid this fee and she requests a loan of US$300.

loans.use: To pay a school fees

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Doung S., 36, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries. She has operated this business since 2004 and is able to earn a gross income of US $15 per day. Her husband sells coffee and sells or rents CDs and VCDs in his village, earning a gross income of US $10 per day. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. She said that this month is a peak season for selling because people have just finished harvesting their rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to run a big store for selling groceries in the province. She also wants build a new nice house for her family.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

Her husband buys sweet potatoes and cows from local farmers in the province in stock and sells them to the markets. He is able to earn a gross income of US $40 per day. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $750 to purchase more sweet potatoes for her husband to resell. This couple works so hard every day and helps each others in the family businesses. The husband always helps his wife in selling noodles and coffee in the morning. This is P.’s first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products like alacarte (grilled meat) such as chicken feet, chicken intestines, chicken wings and others in the local community. Claudio has been engaged in his business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claudio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudio is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claudio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mr. Yun S. is a good father who has given birth to six kids; two of whom are married and live independently and the other four are single. To generate an income, Yun S. works in construction and is also hired by people to construct their new houses. His wife also leaves home to cook food for neighbors' weddings, from which she earns a profit. Yun S. wants to invest in a new trade line in order to create additional revenue and to ensure that his family attains a more comfortable living. Because of the lack of capital, Yun S. is requesting a loan to build a store, where he will begin selling groceries. With the remaining loan he will buy a used vehicle for his family’s traveling needs. (Yun S. and his wife are pictured.)

loans.use: To begin selling groceries.
